analyzed: nyams mi dga' bar rig par byed cing /
translated: He makes them feel uncomfortable.🔽He makes accusations against the householders.

original: khyim la sgro 'dogs par byed pa dang / mi bden pa'i gtam zer bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: khyim la sgro 'dogs par byed pa dang / mi bden pa'i gtam zer bar byed pa ste /
translated: He speaks false words.

original: skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa 'di dag yid brtan pa'i sbyor bas spyo bar bya ba'i chos gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa 'di dag yid brtan pa'i sbyor bas spyo bar bya ba'i chos gsal bar byed do //
translated: These are the things that are to be made clear by the reproval of these non-noble persons through the application of confidence.

original: sh'a ri'i bu de lta na @9a * //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de lta na @9a * //
translated: Śāriputra, it is like this.

original: khyim la ser sna byed pa ni chos dkar po yongs su nyams par byed par gnas so //
analyzed: khyim la ser sna byed pa ni chos dkar po yongs su nyams par byed par gnas so //
translated: Avarice toward the home is a cause for the degeneration of virtuous qualities.

original: yang sh'a ri'i bu khyim la ser sna byed pa la gnas pa skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa de dag gis sdom pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yongs su gtang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang sh'a ri'i bu khyim la ser sna byed pa la gnas pa skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa de dag gis sdom pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yongs su gtang bar 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, Śāriputra, those who are not holy beings, who abide in avarice toward the home, will abandon the bodhisattva who abides in vows.

original: sdom pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rjes su slob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdom pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rjes su slob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not follow the bodhisattva mahāsattva who abides in vows.

original: sh'a ri'i bu de lta bas na khyod kyis rnam grangs 'dis de ltar rig par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de lta bas na khyod kyis rnam grangs 'dis de ltar rig par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Śāriputra, therefore, you should know it in this way through this explanation.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: And in the Perfection of Wisdom Sutra it is said:

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar khyim la ser sna byed pa spang bar bgyi /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar khyim la ser sna byed pa spang bar bgyi /
translated: “How should a bodhisattva mahāsattva abandon avarice toward the home?”

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'di ltar sems bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'di ltar sems bskyed par bya ste /
translated: “Subhūti, here a bodhisattva mahāsattva should generate the following thought:

original: gang bdag gis sems can thams cad la bde ba'i yo byad thams cad sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gang bdag gis sems can thams cad la bde ba'i yo byad thams cad sbyin par bya'o //
translated: I will give all the necessities of happiness to all sentient beings.

original: 'di dag ni rang gi bsod nams kho nas bde ba yin pas /
analyzed: 'di dag ni rang gi bsod nams kho nas bde ba yin pas /
translated: They are happy through their own merit.

original: de la bdag gis ser sna'i sems bskyed bar mi bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de la bdag gis ser sna'i sems bskyed bar mi bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: I should not arouse a stingy mind toward them.

original: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa'i ting nge 'dzin las kyang /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa'i ting nge 'dzin las kyang /
translated: The Sūtra of the Meditative Absorption of the Equal Nature of All Phenomena also says:

original: bdag ni dus rtag phrag dog med 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: bdag ni dus rtag phrag dog med 'gyur zhing //
translated: I will always be free of envy,

original: bdag gis khyim la brten mi 'gyur bar bya //
analyzed: bdag gis khyim la brten mi 'gyur bar bya //
translated: and I will not rely on a household.

original: khyim la chags pa phrag dog 'byung 'gyur te //🔽phrag dog med pa na gas su dga' ba myong //
analyzed: khyim la chags pa phrag dog 'byung 'gyur te // phrag dog med pa na gas su dga' ba myong //
translated: Envy arises from attachment to a household,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: but without envy, I will experience constant joy.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa bskul ba'i mdo las kyang de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa drug cu po de dag la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa bskul ba'i mdo las kyang de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa drug cu po de dag la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: And the Sūtra of Exhortation to Higher Intention says that the Blessed One said this to the sixty individuals who were followers of the Bodhisattva Vehicle:

original: rigs kyi bu dag sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na /
translated: “Noble sons, in the past,

original: bskal pa bzang po 'di nyid la /
analyzed: bskal pa bzang po 'di nyid la /
translated: in this fortunate eon,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa log par dad sel gyi gsung rab la rab tu byung ste 'khod pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa log par dad sel gyi gsung rab la rab tu byung ste 'khod pa /
translated: you went forth in the teachings of the thus-gone Vipaśyin.

original: tshul khrims kyi rgyags pas myos pa /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi rgyags pas myos pa /
translated: You were intoxicated by the arrogance of your discipline,

original: mang du thos pa'i rgyags pas myos pa /🔽sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang yo byed bsnyungs pa la mngon par zhen pa khyed kyis /
analyzed: mang du thos pa'i rgyags pas myos pa / sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang yo byed bsnyungs pa la mngon par zhen pa khyed kyis /
translated: intoxicated by the arrogance of your learning,🔽and you clung to the ascetic practices of austerity.

original: dge slong chos smra ba gnyis la 'di ltar rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i rgyu dang / mdza' bshes kyi khyim dang slong mo ster ba'i khyim gyi gzhi las phrag @9b dog dang ser sna dang ldan pas /
analyzed: dge slong chos smra ba gnyis la 'di ltar rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i rgyu dang / mdza' bshes kyi khyim dang slong mo ster ba'i khyim gyi gzhi las phrag @9b dog dang ser sna dang ldan pas /
translated: You were jealous and stingy, and you slandered two dharma teachers with the accusation of sexual misconduct, on account of your desire for material gain and respect, and because of your attachment to the families of your benefactors and the families that gave you alms.

original: zhe sdang ba'i sems kyis 'khrig pa'i skur bas bskur te /
analyzed: zhe sdang ba'i sems kyis 'khrig pa'i skur bas bskur te /
translated: You did this with a mind of anger.

original: chos smra ba'i dge slong de gnyis kyis mdza' bshes kyi khyim dang / slong mo ster ba'i khyim du gyur pa gang yin pa de rnams kyang khyed kyis phye ste /🔽the tshom bskyed cing ma dad par byas la /
analyzed: chos smra ba'i dge slong de gnyis kyis mdza' bshes kyi khyim dang / slong mo ster ba'i khyim du gyur pa gang yin pa de rnams kyang khyed kyis phye ste / the tshom bskyed cing ma dad par byas la /
translated: and you created doubts and distrust in those who were their friends and in those who gave them alms.

original: dge slong chos smra ba de gnyis la mi snyan pa mang po dag kyang smras /
analyzed: dge slong chos smra ba de gnyis la mi snyan pa mang po dag kyang smras /
translated: You spoke many unpleasant things to those two dharmabhāṇaka bhikṣus.

original: bsngags pa ma yin pa'i skur pa des kyang sems can de rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yang bcad cing dge ba'i rtsa ba la sgrib par byas te /
analyzed: bsngags pa ma yin pa'i skur pa des kyang sems can de rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yang bcad cing dge ba'i rtsa ba la sgrib par byas te /
translated: Through that slander and disparagement, you severed the roots of merit of those beings and created obstacles to their roots of merit.

original: mi dge ba'i las kyi sgrib pa des khyed lo drug khyer sems can dmyal ba chen po mnar med par skyes so //🔽lo bzhi khrir ni sems can dmyal ba chen po yang sos su skyes so //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i las kyi sgrib pa des khyed lo drug khyer sems can dmyal ba chen po mnar med par skyes so // lo bzhi khrir ni sems can dmyal ba chen po yang sos su skyes so //
translated: Because of those obstacles of unwholesome actions, you were born in the great Avīci Hell for six eons.🔽For forty thousand years you were born in the great Saṃjiva Hell.

original: lo nyi khrir ni sems can dmyal ba chen po thig nag tu skyes so //
analyzed: lo nyi khrir ni sems can dmyal ba chen po thig nag tu skyes so //
translated: For twenty thousand years you were born in the great Kālasūtra Hell.

original: lo brgya stong du ni sems can dmyal ba chen po tsha bar skyes so //
analyzed: lo brgya stong du ni sems can dmyal ba chen po tsha bar skyes so //
translated: For a hundred thousand years you were born in the great hell of Saṃjīva.

original: des khyed de nas shi 'phos nas /
analyzed: des khyed de nas shi 'phos nas /
translated: “When you died from there,

original: mi'i lus rnyed pa rnyed ba nas /
analyzed: mi'i lus rnyed pa rnyed ba nas /
translated: you obtained a human body,

original: tshe rabs lnga brgyar mig med de dmus long du gyur to //
analyzed: tshe rabs lnga brgyar mig med de dmus long du gyur to //
translated: but for five hundred lifetimes you were blind, sightless, and eyeless.

original: khyed las kyi sgrib pa de nyid kyi lhag mas /
analyzed: khyed las kyi sgrib pa de nyid kyi lhag mas /
translated: “Due to the remainder of that karmic obscuration,

original: gang dang gang du skyes pa de dang de dag thams cad du sems rtul ba dang / brjed ngas par gyur to //🔽mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sgrib pas bsgribs shing dbang chung bar grags par gyur to //
analyzed: gang dang gang du skyes pa de dang de dag thams cad du sems rtul ba dang / brjed ngas par gyur to // mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sgrib pas bsgribs shing dbang chung bar grags par gyur to //
translated: in all your lives you were dull-witted and forgetful.🔽“You were obscured by the obscurations of the roots of nonvirtue and were known to be of little power.🔽“You were overcome by the faults of ugliness,

original: mi sdug pa'i skyon gyis zil gyis non pa dang / smad pa dang / bshung ba dang / skur ba mang ba dang / yul ngan pa dang / yul 'khor ngan pa dang / ljongs ngan pa dag tu rigs ngan pa dang / dbul po'i rigs dag tu skyes so //
analyzed: mi sdug pa'i skyon gyis zil gyis non pa dang / smad pa dang / bshung ba dang / skur ba mang ba dang / yul ngan pa dang / yul 'khor ngan pa dang / ljongs ngan pa dag tu rigs ngan pa dang / dbul po'i rigs dag tu skyes so //
translated: and you were despised, reviled, and slandered, and you were born in low families, poor families, in bad countries, in bad regions, and in bad kingdoms.

original: rnyed pa chung ba dang / bkur sti chung ba dang / mi bkur ba dang / mi mchod par gyur to //
analyzed: rnyed pa chung ba dang / bkur sti chung ba dang / mi bkur ba dang / mi mchod par gyur to //
translated: They will have little wealth, little respect, and will not be revered or worshipped.

original: des khyed 'di nas shi 'phos nas /
analyzed: des khyed 'di nas shi 'phos nas /
translated: “After you die from here,

original: lnga brgya pa tha ma la /
analyzed: lnga brgya pa tha ma la /
translated: in the final five hundred years,

original: dam pa'i chos nub pa'i dus kyi tshe /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos nub pa'i dus kyi tshe /
translated: at the time when the true Dharma is disappearing,

original: yul ngan pa dang / ljangs  ngan pa dag tu rigs dma' ba dang / dbul po dag tu skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yul ngan pa dang / ljangs  ngan pa dag tu rigs dma' ba dang / dbul po dag tu skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: you will be born in bad countries and bad lands, in low castes and poor families.🔽You will be much slandered, forgetful, abandon the roots of virtue, and even if you make an effort, obstacles will arise.

original: skur ba mang ba dang / brjed ngas pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba spong ba dang / brtson pa byas kyang bar chad 'byung ba dang / khyed la snang ba byung yang phyir nub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skur ba mang ba dang / brjed ngas pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba spong ba dang / brtson pa byas kyang bar chad 'byung ba dang / khyed la snang ba byung yang phyir nub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if you have a vision, it will disappear.

original: khyed la lnga brgya pa tha ma la /
analyzed: khyed la lnga brgya pa tha ma la /
translated: In the final five hundred years,

original: las kyi sgrib pa thams cad zad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa thams cad zad par 'gyur te /
translated: all your karmic obscurations will be exhausted.

original: zad par byas nas /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa @10a * //
analyzed: zad par byas nas / de bzhin gshegs pa @10a * //
translated: Having exhausted them,🔽you will be born in the buddhafield

original: 'od dpag med kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams bde ba can du skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'od dpag med kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams bde ba can du skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: of the Tathāgata Amitābha, the world system Sukhāvatī.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'od dpag med de yang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'od dpag med de yang /
translated: The Tathagata Amitabha

original: khyed bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung ston par 'gyur ro //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: khyed bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung ston par 'gyur ro // zhes gsungs so //
translated: will prophesy your unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: byams pa seng ge sgra'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: byams pa seng ge sgra'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The Maitreya-simhanada Sutra also says:

original: byams pa de la phyi ma'i tshe phyi ma'i dus lnga brgya pa tha ma la /
analyzed: byams pa de la phyi ma'i tshe phyi ma'i dus lnga brgya pa tha ma la /
translated: Maitreya, in the future, in the last five hundred years,

original: byang chub sems dpar khas 'che ba mang po 'byung ba gang yin pa de dag gi sdig pa 'dod pa gang dag yin pa de dag bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpar khas 'che ba mang po 'byung ba gang yin pa de dag gi sdig pa 'dod pa gang dag yin pa de dag bshad par bya'o //
translated: I will explain the sins of those who claim to be bodhisattvas but have many.

original: byams pa byang chub sems dpa' chos bzhi dang ldan na /
analyzed: byams pa byang chub sems dpa' chos bzhi dang ldan na /
translated: Maitreya, if bodhisattvas have four qualities,

original: byang chub sems dpar khas 'che ba yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpar khas 'che ba yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: you should know that they claim to be bodhisattvas.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: rnyed pa 'dod pa dang / bkur sti 'dod pa dang / g-yo byed pa dang / yang ba'i 'tsho bas 'tsho bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rnyed pa 'dod pa dang / bkur sti 'dod pa dang / g-yo byed pa dang / yang ba'i 'tsho bas 'tsho bar byed pa yin te /
translated: They are: desiring gain, desiring honor, being deceitful, and living by a corrupt livelihood.

original: byams pa byang chub sems dpa' chos bzhi po de dag dang ldan na /
analyzed: byams pa byang chub sems dpa' chos bzhi po de dag dang ldan na /
translated: Maitreya, if bodhisattvas have these four qualities,

original: byang chub sems dpar khas 'che ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpar khas 'che ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: You should know that they are hypocrites.

original: byams pa de la phyi ma'i tshe phyi ma'i dus lnga brgya pa tha ma la /🔽byang chub sems dpar khas 'che ba /
analyzed: byams pa de la phyi ma'i tshe phyi ma'i dus lnga brgya pa tha ma la / byang chub sems dpar khas 'che ba /
translated: Maitreya, in the future, in the last five hundred years of the🔽degenerate age,🔽there will be many hypocrites who claim to be bodhisattvas

original: khyi'i chos kun du spyod pa mang po dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: khyi'i chos kun du spyod pa mang po dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: but who act like dogs.

original: byams pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: byams pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Maitreya, it is like this:

original: dper na khyi ni khyim 'ga' zhig tu sngar phyin par gyur la /
analyzed: dper na khyi ni khyim 'ga' zhig tu sngar phyin par gyur la /
translated: Suppose a dog has been in someone’s house before.

original: da khyi gzhan zhig rgyang ring po nas 'ong ba mthong na /🔽de la thugs par byed /
analyzed: da khyi gzhan zhig rgyang ring po nas 'ong ba mthong na / de la thugs par byed /
translated: Later, when it sees another dog coming from far away,

original: 'khren skad 'byin /
analyzed: 'khren skad 'byin /
translated: it barks at it,🔽howls at it,

original: khro bas lta bar byed gnod sems kyis nyes pa skyed par byed de /
analyzed: khro bas lta bar byed gnod sems kyis nyes pa skyed par byed de /
translated: and growls at it with malice.

original: gzhan gyi khyim la bdag gir byed cing /
analyzed: gzhan gyi khyim la bdag gir byed cing /
translated: It acts as if the other dog were in its house,

original: khyim 'di ni bdag gi yin no snyam nas /
analyzed: khyim 'di ni bdag gi yin no snyam nas /
translated: thinking, “This is my house!”

original: bdag gi bar 'du shes skyed par byed do //
analyzed: bdag gi bar 'du shes skyed par byed do //
translated: It generates the perception that it is its own.

original: byams pa de bzhin du phyi ma'i tshe phyi ma'i dus lnga brgya pa tha ma la /
analyzed: byams pa de bzhin du phyi ma'i tshe phyi ma'i dus lnga brgya pa tha ma la /
translated: Maitreya, in the same way, in the future, in the last five hundred years of the🔽degenerate age,

original: byang chub sems dpar khas 'che ba /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpar khas 'che ba /
translated: there will be many hypocrites who claim to be bodhisattvas🔽but who act like dogs.

original: khyi'i chos kun du spyod pa mang po 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang dag yin pa de dag kyang gzhan gyi khyim dag dang gzhan gyi grong dag la bdag nyid kyi yin par 'du shes skyed par byed cing /
analyzed: khyi'i chos kun du spyod pa mang po 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang dag yin pa de dag kyang gzhan gyi khyim dag dang gzhan gyi grong dag la bdag nyid kyi yin par 'du shes skyed par byed cing /
translated: They will behave like dogs, and they will think that other people’s houses and other people’s towns are their own.

original: bdag nyid kyi yin par 'du shes bskyed nas /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi yin par 'du shes bskyed nas /
translated: Thinking that they are their own,

original: yongs su 'dzin par byed de /🔽dge slong des sngon phyin pa'i khyim der /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin par byed de / dge slong des sngon phyin pa'i khyim der /
translated: they will take possession of them.

original: dge slong gzhan zhig 'ong ba mthong nas /
analyzed: dge slong gzhan zhig 'ong ba mthong nas /
translated: “When a monk who has been to that house before sees another monk coming,

original: khyim 'di ni bdag gi yin no snyam nas /
analyzed: khyim 'di ni bdag gi yin no snyam nas /
translated: he will think, ‘That house is mine.’

original: khro bas lta bar byed gnod sems skyed par byed /
analyzed: khro bas lta bar byed gnod sems skyed par byed /
translated: He will look at him with anger and will develop malice.

original: 'thab @10b mo dang / 'thab pa dang / rtsod pa dang / 'gyed pa skyed par byed /🔽phan tshun dbyen gyi tshig smra bar byed /
analyzed: 'thab @10b mo dang / 'thab pa dang / rtsod pa dang / 'gyed pa skyed par byed / phan tshun dbyen gyi tshig smra bar byed /
translated: He will develop quarrels, fights, disputes, and arguments.🔽He will speak divisive words to each other.

original: tshig rtsub mo rjod par byed /
analyzed: tshig rtsub mo rjod par byed /
translated: He will speak harshly to each other.

original: gcig la gcig dge slong che ge mo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gcig la gcig dge slong che ge mo zhes bya ba la /
translated: He will say to each other, ‘Such and such a monk

original: nyes pa 'di lta bu yod do //
analyzed: nyes pa 'di lta bu yod do //
translated: has such and such faults.’

original: dge slong mang ge mo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge slong mang ge mo zhes bya ba la /
translated: He will say, ‘Such and such a monk

original: nyes pa 'di lta bu yod do zhes mi snyan pa rjod par byed cing /
analyzed: nyes pa 'di lta bu yod do zhes mi snyan pa rjod par byed cing /
translated: They say uncomplimentary things about others, saying, ‘Such and such a person has this and that fault.’

original: khyim bdag la yang dge slong che ge mo bsten par mi bya'o //
analyzed: khyim bdag la yang dge slong che ge mo bsten par mi bya'o //
translated: They say to householders, ‘You should not rely on such and such a monk.

original: gal te khyod kho bo bsten par 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te khyod kho bo bsten par 'dod na /
translated: If you want to rely on me,

original: dge slong mang ge mo la ma bsten cig ces zer te /
analyzed: dge slong mang ge mo la ma bsten cig ces zer te /
translated: you should not rely on such and such a monk.’

original: de dag ni skyugs pa'i rgyur gyur pa /
analyzed: de dag ni skyugs pa'i rgyur gyur pa /
translated: They are like vomit,

original: ring du mi gnas pa /
analyzed: ring du mi gnas pa /
translated: not lasting long,

original: smad par bya ba'i kha zas tsam gyi phyir bsod nams ma yin pa mang po skyed pa yin no //
analyzed: smad par bya ba'i kha zas tsam gyi phyir bsod nams ma yin pa mang po skyed pa yin no //
translated: and they create much demerit for the sake of just a little food that is to be despised.

original: de dag ni yi dags la brten pa'i chos kun tu spyod cing /
analyzed: de dag ni yi dags la brten pa'i chos kun tu spyod cing /
translated: They practice the Dharma of the hungry ghosts,

original: dbul ba dang / sems dman pa dang / ser sna dang ldan pa dang / bdag nyid gso bar byed pa yin te /

analyzed: 'od srungs kyis zhus pa'i mdo las kyang / 'do srungs chos bzhi dang ldan na /

translated: 1. hypocrisy of the body, 2. hypocrisy of speech, 3. hypocrisy of the mind, and 4. hypocrisy of deportment.

analyzed: de la lus kyi tshul 'chos pa gang zhe na /

translated: They will not seek the qualities of dwelling in the forest but will pretend to dwell in the forest. They will not give up the idea of alms but will pretend to go for alms.🔽They will not follow shame and modesty but will pretend to wear rags from the rubbish heap.

translated: They will not enter into dependent origination but will pretend to live under a tree or in a place with grass. They will not seek the medicine of the nectar of the Dharma but will pretend to take medicine that is despised.

original: 'do srungs 'di dag ni lus kyi tshul 'chos par brjod do //🔽bdag che ge mos yongs su shes /
analyzed: 'do srungs 'di dag ni lus kyi tshul 'chos par brjod do // bdag che ge mos yongs su shes /

analyzed: bdag che ge mos mgron du gnyer /

original: bdag gis rnyed @17a * //
analyzed: bdag gis rnyed @17a * //

analyzed: pa gus par byas te rnyed do //

original: bdag gis gya nom pa rnyed do //
analyzed: bdag gis gya nom pa rnyed do //

original: bdag gis mang du rnyed do //
analyzed: bdag gis mang du rnyed do //

original: bdag gis mang du thos so //
analyzed: bdag gis mang du thos so //

analyzed: bdag ni tshul khrims dang ldan zhing dge ba'i chos can no //

analyzed: bdag ni lan du mar mgron du gnyer 'os pa'o //

analyzed: bdag ni nus pa skal pa dang ldan pa shin tu stobs dang ldan pa'o //

analyzed: bdag ni don dang don rnam par nges pa la mkhas pa'o //

analyzed: che ge mo zhig gis bdag la 'di skad du smras te / bdag gis tshar bcad cing spobs pa med par byas so //

original: bdag gis 'khor mngon par mgu bar byas so //
analyzed: bdag gis 'khor mngon par mgu bar byas so //

original: bdag gis legs so zhes bya ba rnyed do //
analyzed: bdag gis legs so zhes bya ba rnyed do //
translated: I have obtained approval.

original: bdag gis de las gos rnyed do //
analyzed: bdag gis de las gos rnyed do //

analyzed: bdag ni yang nas yang du 'ong bar bya ba'i phyir mgron du gnyer to //

original: 'od srungs de ltar rnam par ma dpyad pa'i sems dang ldan pa'i dag gis brjod pa gang ci yang rung ba de dag thams cad ni mngon par mi brtson pa rnams kyi ngag gi tshul 'chos pa yin gyi /

translated: Kāśyapa, in this way, whatever is said by those who have a mind that does not analyze is all the hypocrisy of speech of those who are not striving,

original: mngon par brtson pa rnams kyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon par brtson pa rnams kyi ni ma yin te /
translated: but not of those who are striving.

original: 'di ni ngag gi tshul 'chos pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ngag gi tshul 'chos pa'o //

original: 'od srungs de la sems kyi tshul 'chos pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'od srungs de la sems kyi tshul 'chos pa gang zhe na /
translated: Kāśyapa, what is the hypocrisy of mind?

analyzed: tshig tu nga la cung zad kyang mi dgos so zhes smra ba ste /

original: gang sems kyis rnyed pa 'dod cing /
analyzed: gang sems kyis rnyed pa 'dod cing /

analyzed: tshig gis 'dod pa chung bar smra ba 'di ni sems kyi tshul 'chos pa zhes brjod do //

original: de la 'di skad du bka' stsal te /
analyzed: de la 'di skad du bka' stsal te /

original: 'di na 'gas kyang bdag la don med ces smra ba //
analyzed: 'di na 'gas kyang bdag la don med ces smra ba //

analyzed: yang dag min pa'i ngo bo'i rgyags pas chags par 'gyur //

original: de ni nam yang bde ba rnyed ldan 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: de ni nam yang bde ba rnyed ldan 'gyur ma yin //

original: lha dang klu rnams lha min ldan pa dag kyang ni //
analyzed: lha dang klu rnams lha min ldan pa dag kyang ni //
translated: Even gods, nāgas, and asuras are deceived

analyzed: sems dang bsam pa tshul 'chos can gyis slu bar byed //

analyzed: nyams pa'i sems kyis nams kyang dag par 'gyur ba min //

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyis mkhyen par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyis mkhyen par 'gyur //

original: 'od srungs de ltar @17b na tshul ma yin pa spyad pa'i spyod pa ya nga ba de lta bu'i ngo bo 'dis chos dang mi ldan pa /
analyzed: 'od srungs de ltar @17b na tshul ma yin pa spyad pa'i spyod pa ya nga ba de lta bu'i ngo bo 'dis chos dang mi ldan pa /
translated: Kāśyapa, in this way, this kind of essence of the practice of improper practice leads to fear.

original: sdig pa'i dge sbyong dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du 'gro bar byed par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sdig pa'i dge sbyong dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du 'gro bar byed par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: It leads to the unrighteous, to the sinful, to the hell realm, to the animal realm, and to the realm of the Lord of Death.”

original: klu'i rgyal po rgya mtshos zhus pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po rgya mtshos zhus pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The Sūtra on the Questions of the Nāga King Sāgara also says:

analyzed: zas bzhi po 'di dag ni dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du 'gro bar byed par 'gyur te /

original: bzhi po gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: grogs po dag zas gang srog gcod pa dang / srog la 'tshe ba dang / srog 'joms pas longs spyod par byed de grogs po dag zas dang po 'dis ni dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang ; gshin rje'i 'jig rten du 'gro bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grogs po dag zas gang srog gcod pa dang / srog la 'tshe ba dang / srog 'joms pas longs spyod par byed de grogs po dag zas dang po 'dis ni dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang ; gshin rje'i 'jig rten du 'gro bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Friends, there is food that is enjoyed by those who kill, harm, and destroy life. Friends, through this first food, one goes to the hell realm, to the animal realm, and to the realm of the Lord of Death.”

original: grogs po dag gzhan yang zas gang ma byin par len pa nyid dang / gzhan gyi longs spyod rnam par bcom pa nyid dang / dbyug pa dang / ral gri dang / mtshon gyis btab pa nyid kyis longs spyod pa ste /
analyzed: grogs po dag gzhan yang zas gang ma byin par len pa nyid dang / gzhan gyi longs spyod rnam par bcom pa nyid dang / dbyug pa dang / ral gri dang / mtshon gyis btab pa nyid kyis longs spyod pa ste /
translated: Friends, there is also the food that is taken without being given, the enjoyment of the wealth of others through destruction, and the enjoyment of wealth through the use of sticks, swords, and weapons.

original: gnyis pa 'di dang / grogs po dag gzhan yang zas gang tshul 'chos pa dang / kha gsag nyid dang / gzhan ches gzir ba nyid dang / spyod lam dag par nye bar ston pa nyid dang / tshul khrims nyams pa nyid dang / spyod pa nyams pa nyid dang /
analyzed: gnyis pa 'di dang / grogs po dag gzhan yang zas gang tshul 'chos pa dang / kha gsag nyid dang / gzhan ches gzir ba nyid dang / spyod lam dag par nye bar ston pa nyid dang / tshul khrims nyams pa nyid dang / spyod pa nyams pa nyid dang /
translated: Friends, there is also the food that is taken through hypocrisy, flattery, and the oppression of others, through the display of pure behavior, through the violation of moral discipline, through the violation of proper conduct,

original: lta ba nyams pa nyid dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yon tan gyis longs spyod pa ste /
analyzed: lta ba nyams pa nyid dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yon tan gyis longs spyod pa ste /
translated: through the violation of right views, and through the enjoyment of wealth through false qualities.

original: gsum pa 'di dang / grogs po dag gzhan yang gang ston pa ma yin par ston par khas 'che ba nyid dang / yang dag pa ma rtogs par yang dag par rtogs par khas 'che ba nyid dang / dge sbyong ma yin par dge sbyong du khas 'che ba nyid kyis longs spyod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa 'di dang / grogs po dag gzhan yang gang ston pa ma yin par ston par khas 'che ba nyid dang / yang dag pa ma rtogs par yang dag par rtogs par khas 'che ba nyid dang / dge sbyong ma yin par dge sbyong du khas 'che ba nyid kyis longs spyod par byed pa ste /
translated: Friends, there are those who enjoy a life of luxury by pretending to be teachers when they are not, by pretending to have realized the truth when they have not, and by pretending to be spiritual practitioners when they are not.

original: zas bzhi po 'dis ni /
analyzed: zas bzhi po 'dis ni /
translated: These four kinds of food

original: dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du 'gro bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du 'gro bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: lead to the realms of hell beings, animals, and hungry ghosts.

original: grogs po dag ngas zas bzhi po 'di dag gcad par bya ba'i phyir chos bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: grogs po dag ngas zas bzhi po 'di dag gcad par bya ba'i phyir chos bstan par bya ste /
translated: Friends, I teach the Dharma in order to cut off these four kinds of food.

analyzed: grogs po dag lus gso bar bya ba'i phyir srog gcad par mi bya'o //
translated: Friends, do not kill in order to sustain your body.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: srog ni sems can thams cad la phangs pa dang / yid du 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: srog ni sems can thams cad la phangs pa dang / yid du 'ong ba'o //

original: grogs po dag de'i phyir bdag bsrung bar bya ba'i phyir dang / 'jig rten pha rol bsrung bar bya ba'i phyir dang / sems can thams cad kyi bde ba bsrung bar bya ba'i @18a * //
analyzed: grogs po dag de'i phyir bdag bsrung bar bya ba'i phyir dang / 'jig rten pha rol bsrung bar bya ba'i phyir dang / sems can thams cad kyi bde ba bsrung bar bya ba'i @18a * //
translated: Therefore, friends, in order to protect oneself, in order to protect the next world, and in order to protect the happiness of all sentient beings,

analyzed: phyir mkhas pas srog gi phyir yang sdig pa mi bya zhing bya ba ma yin pa mi bya'o zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdus nas bca' ba byas pa /

analyzed: bdag cag gi nang nas sus kyang grong du 'jug par mi bya'o //

analyzed: khyod ni shes bzhin med par spyod pa yin te /

analyzed: nyung du smra ba ma yin gyis khyod grong du 'gro bas kyang ci zhig bya ste /
translated: You are not one who speaks little. What is the point of your going to town?

original: dgon pa la gnas pa ni /
analyzed: dgon pa la gnas pa ni /
translated: Dwelling in the wilderness

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang zhing bsngags pa yin gyi khyod grong du ma 'dong bar bsam gtan gyi bde bas rnam par spyod cig ces bsgo'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang zhing bsngags pa yin gyi khyod grong du ma 'dong bar bsam gtan gyi bde bas rnam par spyod cig ces bsgo'o //
translated: is what the Bhagavat permitted and praised. You should not go to town. You should enjoy the happiness of dhyāna.’

original: rigs kyi bu de nas spyod pa rnam par dag pas de'i 'khor gyis de zer ba ltar ma mnyan te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de nas spyod pa rnam par dag pas de'i 'khor gyis de zer ba ltar ma mnyan te /
translated: “Son of noble family, the pure conduct of that bhikṣu was not heeded by his followers, who said,

original: yang dang yang grong dag tu 'dong bar gyur to //
analyzed: yang dang yang grong dag tu 'dong bar gyur to //
translated: ‘We will go to town again and again.’

original: rigs kyi bu de nas dge slong de dag nam grong nas phyir 'ongs par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de nas dge slong de dag nam grong nas phyir 'ongs par gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: “Son of noble family, when those bhikṣus returned from town,

analyzed: dge slong spyod pa'i blo gros kyis yang gand'i brdungs nas /
translated: the bhikṣu Intelligent Conduct again struck the ghaṇṭā and said,

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdus te /
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdus te /
translated: He gathered the saṅgha of bhikṣus

analyzed: 'di skad du gal te da phyin chad khyod grong du 'dong dang / khyod gtsug lag khang 'di na ma gnas zhes bsgo'o //

original: rigs kyi bu de nas dge slong chos smra ba spyod pa rnam par dag pas /🔽dge slong de'i sems bsrung ba'i phyir rang gi 'khor rnams bos te 'di skad du /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de nas dge slong chos smra ba spyod pa rnam par dag pas / dge slong de'i sems bsrung ba'i phyir rang gi 'khor rnams bos te 'di skad du /
translated: “Noble son, the bhikṣu Dharmabhāṇaka Viśuddhacāritra

analyzed: khyed grong du su yang ma 'dod cig ces smras so //
translated: then called his followers and said to them, ‘None of you should go to the village.’

analyzed: de nas de'i tshe dge slong de dag gis sems can gang ji snyed cig smin par byas pa de dag dge slong de dag dang ma phrad pas /

original: shin tu mi dga' bar yang gyur /
analyzed: shin tu mi dga' bar yang gyur /

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba yang yongs su 'gribs par gyur to //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba yang yongs su 'gribs par gyur to //
translated: Their roots of virtue diminished.

original: rigs kyi bu de nas dge slong chos smra ba spyod pa rnam par dag pa zla ba gsum po de dag 'das nas /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de nas dge slong chos smra ba spyod pa rnam par dag pa zla ba gsum po de dag 'das nas /
translated: “Noble son, after those three months had passed, the bhikṣu Dharmabhāṇaka Viśuddhacāritra

original: gtsug lag khang de nas gtsug lag khang gzhan du 'phos nas /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang de nas gtsug lag khang gzhan du 'phos nas /
translated: He would move from one temple to another,

analyzed: grong dang / grong khyer dang / ljongs dang / yul dang / rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor dag tu 'gro zhing /

original: sems can dag la chos ston par gyur to //
analyzed: sems can dag la chos ston par gyur to //
translated: and he would teach the Dharma to sentient beings.

analyzed: rigs kyi bu de nas dge slong spyod pa'i blo gros kyis chos smra ba spyod pa rnam par dag pa yang dang yang du 'gro ba yang mthong /

analyzed: de'i 'khor rnams kyang spyod lam tha mal pa can du mthong nas des kyang de la ma dad pa'i sems bskyed par gyur te /

analyzed: dge slong 'di ni tshul khrims 'chal pa can /
translated: thinking, ‘This monk has broken his vows.

original: tshul khrims log pa can te /
analyzed: tshul khrims log pa can te /
translated: He has violated his vows.

original: 'dis byang chub ga la 'thob /
analyzed: 'dis byang chub ga la 'thob /
translated: How could he attain awakening?

original: dge slong 'di'i @21b byang chub ni rgyang ring ngo //
analyzed: dge slong 'di'i @21b byang chub ni rgyang ring ngo //
translated: This monk’s awakening is far away.

analyzed: dge slong 'di ni 'du 'dzir gnas pa'o zhes 'gro ba mang po dag la de skad ces brjod do //

analyzed: rigs kyi bu de nas dus gzhan zhig na dge slong spyod pa'i blo gros de 'chi ba'i dus byas par gyur nas /
translated: “Son of noble family, later on, the monk Cāritramati died.

analyzed: de de ltar 'chi ba'i dus byas pa dang / las de'i rnam par smin pas mnar med pa'i sems can dmyal ba chen por lhung ngo //
translated: When he died, the ripening of that karma caused him to fall into the great hell of Avīci.

original: de bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig dgu bcu rtsa dgur sems can dmyal ba chen por sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba myong bar gyur nas /
analyzed: de bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig dgu bcu rtsa dgur sems can dmyal ba chen por sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba myong bar gyur nas /
translated: He experienced the suffering of the great hells for ninety-nine quintillion eons.

original: tshe rabs drug cur mi snyan par brjod pa thob par gyur to //
analyzed: tshe rabs drug cur mi snyan par brjod pa thob par gyur to //
translated: For sixty lifetimes he was reviled.

original: tshe rabs stong phrag sum cu rtsa gnyis su rab tu byung ba las phyir babs par gyur to //
analyzed: tshe rabs stong phrag sum cu rtsa gnyis su rab tu byung ba las phyir babs par gyur to //
translated: For thirty-two thousand lifetimes he was forced to disrobe.

original: las kyi sgrib pa de nyid kyi lhag mas /
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa de nyid kyi lhag mas /
translated: Due to the remainder of that karmic obscuration,

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od 'phro dri ma med pa'i gsung rab la rab tu byung bar gyur to //

analyzed: de rab tu byung nas lo bye ba brgya stong phrag drug tu mgo'i thod la me 'bar ba ltar rnam par spyad kyang /

original: mthun pa'i bzod pa tsam yang ma thob ste /
analyzed: mthun pa'i bzod pa tsam yang ma thob ste /
translated: After he went forth, he practiced for six hundred thousand million years as if his head were on fire, but he did not even attain the acceptance of conformity.

original: tshe rabs brgya stong mang por dbang po rtul por gyur to //🔽rigs kyi bu de'i tshe de'i dus na /
analyzed: tshe rabs brgya stong mang por dbang po rtul por gyur to // rigs kyi bu de'i tshe de'i dus na /
translated: For many hundreds of thousands of lives he had dull faculties.

original: dge slong chos smra ba spyod pa rnam par dag pha zhes bya ba de gzhan yin par sems na de ltar mi blta ste /🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong chos smra ba spyod pa rnam par dag pha zhes bya ba de gzhan yin par sems na de ltar mi blta ste / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: “Noble son, if you think that the bhikṣu Dharmabhāṇaka Viśuddhacāritra at that time, on that occasion, was anyone else, do not see him in that way.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mi sgul ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mi sgul ba ni /
translated: If you ask why, it is because the tathāgata Akṣobhya was the bhikṣu Dharmabhāṇaka Viśuddhacāritra at that time, on that occasion.🔽“Noble son, if you think that the bhikṣu Dharmabhāṇaka Cāritramati at that time, on that occasion, was anyone else, do not see him in that way.

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na dge slong chos smra ba spyod pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya bar gyur to //🔽rigs kyi bu de'i tshe de'i dus na /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na dge slong chos smra ba spyod pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya bar gyur to // rigs kyi bu de'i tshe de'i dus na /
translated: If you ask why, it is because the bhikṣu Dharmabhāṇaka Viśuddhacāritra at that time, on that occasion, was the bhikṣu Dharmabhāṇaka Cāritramati.

original: dge slong chos smra ba spyod pa'i blo gros zhes bya ba de gzhan zhig yin pa snyam du sems na de snyam du mi blta ste /
analyzed: dge slong chos smra ba spyod pa'i blo gros zhes bya ba de gzhan zhig yin pa snyam du sems na de snyam du mi blta ste /
translated: “Noble son, if you think that the bhikṣu Dharmabhāṇaka Viśuddhacāritra at that time, on that occasion, was anyone else, do not see him in that way.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why, it is because the bhikṣu Dharmabhāṇaka Viśuddhacāritra at that time, on that occasion, was the bhikṣu Dharmabhāṇaka Cāritramati.

original: nga ni dge slong chos smra ba spyod pa'i blo gros zhes bya bar gyur te /
analyzed: nga ni dge slong chos smra ba spyod pa'i blo gros zhes bya bar gyur te /

original: nga yang de lta bu'i thabs phra mos de la ma dad pa'i sems bskyed de /
analyzed: nga yang de lta bu'i thabs phra mos de la ma dad pa'i sems bskyed de /
translated: I also, through such a subtle method, generated a mind of lack of faith in him.

original: las kyi sgrib pa mngon par 'du byas pas sems can dmyal ba dag tu lhung bar gyur te /
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa mngon par 'du byas pas sems can dmyal ba dag tu lhung bar gyur te /
translated: Through the creation of karmic obscurations, I fell into the hells.

original: rigs kyi bu de ltar phra ba ni las kyi sgrib pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de ltar phra ba ni las kyi sgrib pa yin gyi /
translated: Son of noble family, such is the subtlety of karmic obscurations.

original: rigs kyi bu las kyi sgrib pa de lta bu mi 'dod pa de dag gis gzhan gyi spyod pa la khong khro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu las kyi sgrib pa de lta bu mi 'dod pa de dag gis gzhan gyi spyod pa la khong khro bar mi bya'o //
translated: Son of noble family, those who do not wish for such karmic obscurations should not be angry at the conduct of others.

original: de'i spyod pa thams cad la yid ches par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i spyod pa thams cad la yid ches par bya'o //
translated: They should have confidence in all their conduct.

original: 'di snyam du pha rol gyi sems ni bdag gis mi shes te /🔽sems can gyi spyod @22a * //
analyzed: 'di snyam du pha rol gyi sems ni bdag gis mi shes te / sems can gyi spyod @22a * //
translated: They should think, ‘I do not know the minds of others.

original: pa ni shes par dka'o //
analyzed: pa ni shes par dka'o //
translated: The conduct of sentient beings is difficult to know.

original: de snyam du sems bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: de snyam du sems bskyed par bya'o //
translated: They should generate that thought.

original: don gyi dbang de gzigs nas de bzhin gshegs pas 'di skad du chos bstan te /
analyzed: don gyi dbang de gzigs nas de bzhin gshegs pas 'di skad du chos bstan te /
translated: Seeing that power of the meaning, the Tathāgata taught the Dharma in this way:

analyzed: gang zag gis gang zag gi tshod gzung bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not judge people by one’s own standards.

original: gang zag gis gang zag la tshod bzung na /
analyzed: gang zag gis gang zag la tshod bzung na /
translated: If one judges people by one’s own standards,

original: rma 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rma 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: one will be wounded.

analyzed: nga 'am gzhan yang nga dang 'dra ba dag gis gang zag la tshod bzung ba'o //
translated: Either I or someone like me should judge people.

original: rigs kyi bu su bdag bsrung bar 'dod pa des gzhan su'i spyod pa la yang brtag par mi bya'o //🔽de dag la 'di ni 'di 'dra'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu su bdag bsrung bar 'dod pa des gzhan su'i spyod pa la yang brtag par mi bya'o // de dag la 'di ni 'di 'dra'o //
translated: Son of noble family, those who wish to protect themselves should not examine the conduct of others.🔽They should not say, ‘This is like that,

original: 'di ni 'di 'dra'o zhes dpya bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'di 'dra'o zhes dpya bar mi bya'o //
translated: that is like this.’

original: nyin mtshan du sangs rgyas kyi chos la brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: nyin mtshan du sangs rgyas kyi chos la brtson par bya'o //
translated: Day and night, they should strive in the teachings of the Buddha.

original: rigs kyi bu chos la bsgom pa'i yid kyis bsam pa thag pa nas yang dag par zhugs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu chos la bsgom pa'i yid kyis bsam pa thag pa nas yang dag par zhugs pa'i phyir /
translated: Son of noble family, because the mind that meditates on the Dharma is correctly engaged from the depths of one’s thoughts,

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhan la dpya bar brtson par mi gnas so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhan la dpya bar brtson par mi gnas so //
translated: bodhisattvas do not strive to judge others.

original: rigs kyi bu gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na /
translated: Son of noble family, if in this world system of a billion worlds

original: sems can gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad byang chub sems dpa' la la zhig gis dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod pa pas /
analyzed: sems can gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad byang chub sems dpa' la la zhig gis dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod pa pas /
translated: Suppose that all those sentient beings were established in the ten wholesome courses of action by some bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang gcig pu dben par 'dug ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang gcig pu dben par 'dug ste /
translated: If another bodhisattva were to sit alone in solitude

original: chung ngu na se gol gtogs pa tsam du'ang chos thams cad tshul gcig par yid ches shing /
analyzed: chung ngu na se gol gtogs pa tsam du'ang chos thams cad tshul gcig par yid ches shing /
translated: and for even the time it takes to snap one’s fingers have confidence in the single mode of all phenomena,

original: tha na chung ngu na 'dri ba 'am /
analyzed: tha na chung ngu na 'dri ba 'am /
translated: or even if he were to ask about it,

original: dpyad pa 'am /
analyzed: dpyad pa 'am /
translated: or analyze it,🔽or recite it,

original: lung 'bogs pa 'am /
analyzed: lung 'bogs pa 'am /
translated: or reflect on it,

original: kha ton bya ba'i phyir gnas na 'di ni de bas ches bsod nams mang du 'phel lo //
analyzed: kha ton bya ba'i phyir gnas na 'di ni de bas ches bsod nams mang du 'phel lo //
translated: then the latter would generate incalculably more goodness than the former.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rigs kyi bu tshul 'di khong du chud pas /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu tshul 'di khong du chud pas /
translated: Noble sir, through mastering this method

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams las kyi sgrib pa thams cad rnam par dag pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams las kyi sgrib pa thams cad rnam par dag pa 'thob bo //
translated: the bodhisattvas attain the purification of all karmic actions.

original: sems can thams cad la chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang bral bar gyur to //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang bral bar gyur to //
translated: They become free from attachment and aversion to all sentient beings.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa yang myur du 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa yang myur du 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: And they will quickly attain omniscience.

original: sangs rgyas spong ba'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas spong ba'i mdo las kyang /
translated: And in the Buddha-abandoning Sutra it says,

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: Then the Lord

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bag cha ba med pa la gnas pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bag cha ba med pa la gnas pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: said this to the bodhisattva-mahasattva Asangasta:

analyzed: rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bcu po 'di dag thams cad kyis ni sangs rgyas spong bar byas so //
translated: “Son of good family, all these ten bodhisattva-mahasattvas have abandoned the Buddha.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das sangs @22b rgyas spong pa zhes bgyi ba de gang lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das sangs @22b rgyas spong pa zhes bgyi ba de gang lags /
translated: He said, “Lord, what is this ‘abandoning the Buddha’?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rigs kyi bu sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na bskal pa sum cu 'das pa de'i tshe de'i dus na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na bskal pa sum cu 'das pa de'i tshe de'i dus na /
translated: “Son of good family, in the past, thirty eons ago,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams smig rgyu can du de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par gzigs pa'i nga ro can zhes bya ba byung bar gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams smig rgyu can du de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par gzigs pa'i nga ro can zhes bya ba byung bar gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: in the world system called Mirage, there was a tathagata called Roar of Vision.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyi ma'i dus phyi ma'i tshe na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyi ma'i dus phyi ma'i tshe na /
translated: After the Tathāgata’s parinirvāṇa, in the later time, in the later era,

original: rigs kyi bu bcu po 'di dag shing s'a la chen po lta bu'i gzhon nur gyur to //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu bcu po 'di dag shing s'a la chen po lta bu'i gzhon nur gyur to //
translated: these ten sons of good family became youths like great śāla trees.

original: de'i tshe rigs kyi bu bcu po 'di dag thams cad kyis gtsug lag khang lnga brgya byed du bcug go //
analyzed: de'i tshe rigs kyi bu bcu po 'di dag thams cad kyis gtsug lag khang lnga brgya byed du bcug go //
translated: At that time, all ten of these sons of good family had five hundred monasteries built.

original: gtsug lag khang re rer yang dge slong stong stong gnas par gyur to //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang re rer yang dge slong stong stong gnas par gyur to //
translated: In each monastery, one thousand monks resided.

original: rigs kyi bu de'i tshe chos smra ba spobs pa brtsegs pa zhes bya ba gzungs thob pa zhig chos ston no //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de'i tshe chos smra ba spobs pa brtsegs pa zhes bya ba gzungs thob pa zhig chos ston no //
translated: Son of good family, at that time, a Dharma teacher named Pratibhānakūṭa, who had attained dhāraṇī, taught the Dharma.

original: rigs kyi bu chos smra ba spobs pa brtsegs pa de chos kyi stan la 'dug pa la sangs rgyas lnga stong spobs pa grub par mdzad de /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu chos smra ba spobs pa brtsegs pa de chos kyi stan la 'dug pa la sangs rgyas lnga stong spobs pa grub par mdzad de /
translated: Son of good family, when that Dharma teacher Pratibhānakūṭa sat on the Dharma seat, five thousand buddhas bestowed eloquence upon him.

original: lha dung phyur phrag brgyad kyang /
analyzed: lha dung phyur phrag brgyad kyang /
translated: Eight hundred million gods

original: lus yongs su sbyang ba'i phyir brtson par gyur to //
analyzed: lus yongs su sbyang ba'i phyir brtson par gyur to //
translated: also exerted themselves in purifying their bodies.

original: de'i chos bshad pa gcig gis srog chags bdun khri bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par gyur to //
analyzed: de'i chos bshad pa gcig gis srog chags bdun khri bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par gyur to //
translated: By his preaching of the Dharma, seventy thousand living beings were established in irreversibility from supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: srog chags khri ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob bo //
analyzed: srog chags khri ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob bo //
translated: Ten thousand living beings attained the fruit of entering the stream.

original: rigs kyi bu de'i tshe rgyal po zla bas byin pa zhes bya ba zhig byung ngo //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de'i tshe rgyal po zla bas byin pa zhes bya ba zhig byung ngo //
translated: “Noble sir, at that time there was a king named Candra­pradīpa.

original: des chos la gus pas chos smra ba de la mchod pa'i phyir bud med lnga brgya dang / glu dbyangs dang rol mo byas so //
analyzed: des chos la gus pas chos smra ba de la mchod pa'i phyir bud med lnga brgya dang / glu dbyangs dang rol mo byas so //
translated: Out of respect for the Dharma, he had five hundred women sing and play music in order to make offerings to that Dharma preacher.

original: dge slong de la rin po che'i me tog sna tshogs kyis kyang mngon par gtor te /
analyzed: dge slong de la rin po che'i me tog sna tshogs kyis kyang mngon par gtor te /
translated: He also scattered various precious flowers over that monk.

original: tsandan gyi byug pas kyang byugs so //
analyzed: tsandan gyi byug pas kyang byugs so //
translated: He anointed him with sandalwood ointment.

original: ras bcos bu lnga brgyas kyang bkab bo //
analyzed: ras bcos bu lnga brgyas kyang bkab bo //
translated: He covered him with five hundred garments.

original: bde ba'i rim gro thams cad kyis mchod pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bde ba'i rim gro thams cad kyis mchod pa 'di lta ste /
translated: He made offerings to him with all the requisites of happiness, such as

original: chos smra ba la mchod pa'i mchog gis zhag bdun du rim gro byas so //
analyzed: chos smra ba la mchod pa'i mchog gis zhag bdun du rim gro byas so //
translated: the best offerings to Dharma preachers. He served him for seven days.

original: de nas dge slong de la khyim bdag gi bu de dag gis 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyis glengs so //
analyzed: de nas dge slong de la khyim bdag gi bu de dag gis 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyis glengs so //
translated: Then those sons of the householder accused that bhikṣu of having faulty morality.

original: las de'i rnam par smin pas de dag lo dgu khrir sems can dmyal ba rnams su skyes so //
analyzed: las de'i rnam par smin pas de dag lo dgu khrir sems can dmyal ba rnams su skyes so //
translated: As a result of that karma, they were born in the hells for ninety thousand years.

original: tshe rabs lnga brgyar ni mi rnams kyi nang du za ma dang kla klo dang / log par lta ba'i khyim rnams su skyes so //
analyzed: tshe rabs lnga brgyar ni mi rnams kyi nang du za ma dang kla klo dang / log par lta ba'i khyim rnams su skyes so //
translated: For five hundred lifetimes, they were born among humans as eunuchs, barbarians, and in families with wrong views.

original: tshe rabs drug brgyar ni dmus long dang / lce med par gyur to //🔽tshe @23a * //
analyzed: tshe rabs drug brgyar ni dmus long dang / lce med par gyur to // tshe @23a * //
translated: For six hundred lifetimes, they were born blind and without tongues.

original: rabs bdun brgyar ni rab tu byung nas /
analyzed: rabs bdun brgyar ni rab tu byung nas /
translated: For seven hundred lifetimes, they went forth

original: ji srid 'tsho'i mthar thug gi bar du gzungs ma thob par 'chi ba'i dus byas te /
analyzed: ji srid 'tsho'i mthar thug gi bar du gzungs ma thob par 'chi ba'i dus byas te /
translated: and died without attaining the dhāraṇīs.

original: las kyi sgrib pa de nyid kyis rigs kyi bu de dag bsgribs so //
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa de nyid kyis rigs kyi bu de dag bsgribs so //
translated: By that very karmic obscuration, those sons of good family were obscured.

original: rigs kyi bu de lta bas na khyod mos par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de lta bas na khyod mos par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, son of good family, you should have conviction.

original: khyod kyis khong du chud par bya'o /
analyzed: khyod kyis khong du chud par bya'o /
translated: You should understand.

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di thos nas /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di thos nas /
translated: Having heard this Dharma discourse,

original: chos smra ba la mngon sum du mthong yang 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyis brjod par mi bya na thos pas lta ci smos /
analyzed: chos smra ba la mngon sum du mthong yang 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyis brjod par mi bya na thos pas lta ci smos /
translated: If you should not speak of a Dharma teacher even if you have seen him in person, because of your own faulty morality, what need is there to mention what you have heard?

original: rigs kyi bu gang zhig sems can thams cad kyi mig 'byin par byed pa bas ni /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gang zhig sems can thams cad kyi mig 'byin par byed pa bas ni /
translated: “Son of noble family, compared to someone who plucks out the eyes of all sentient beings,

original: gang zhig chos smra ba la gshe ba'i bsam pas lta bar byed na /
analyzed: gang zhig chos smra ba la gshe ba'i bsam pas lta bar byed na /
translated: if someone were to look at a Dharma teacher with a hostile intent,

original: de ni de bas ches kha na ma tho ba'i las che ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni de bas ches kha na ma tho ba'i las che ba yin no //
translated: that would be a much worse offense.

original: gang zhig sems can thams cad 'ching bar byed la /
analyzed: gang zhig sems can thams cad 'ching bar byed la /
translated: Compared to someone who binds all sentient beings,

original: gang zhig chos smra ba mthong na rgyab kyis phyogs te /
analyzed: gang zhig chos smra ba mthong na rgyab kyis phyogs te /
translated: if someone were to turn their back on a Dharma teacher and sit down,

original: 'dug par byed na bsod nams ma yin pa 'di la bsod nams ma yin pa snga ma des brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro /
analyzed: 'dug par byed na bsod nams ma yin pa 'di la bsod nams ma yin pa snga ma des brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro /
translated: the demerit in this case would be such that the previous demerit would not even amount to a hundredth part of it.

original: stong gi cha dang / 'bum gyi cha dang / grangs dang / bgrang ba dang / dpe dang / rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: stong gi cha dang / 'bum gyi cha dang / grangs dang / bgrang ba dang / dpe dang / rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: It would not even come close to a thousandth, a hundred-thousandth part, or any number, or any calculation, or any example, or any comparison.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang chos smra ba la skur pa 'debs pa des ni sangs rgyas la skur pa btab par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //🔽sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur bya bar 'dod pas chos smra ba la bsnyen bkur bya'o //
analyzed: gang chos smra ba la skur pa 'debs pa des ni sangs rgyas la skur pa btab par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur bya bar 'dod pas chos smra ba la bsnyen bkur bya'o //
translated: Because whoever disparages the Dharma teacher disparages the Buddha.🔽One who wishes to serve the Buddha should serve the Dharma teacher.

original: sangs rgyas la mchod par 'dod pas /🔽chos smra ba la mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la mchod par 'dod pas / chos smra ba la mchod par bya'o //
translated: One who wishes to worship the Buddha should worship the Dharma teacher.

original: sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal bar 'dod pas chos smra ba la phyag bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal bar 'dod pas chos smra ba la phyag bya'o //
translated: One who wishes to pay homage to the Buddha should pay homage to the Dharma teacher.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' las byung ba'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' las byung ba'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the state of omniscience arises from the bodhisattva, and the Blessed Buddhas arise from the bodhisattva.

original: gang la brten te byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de la brten nas /
analyzed: gang la brten te byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de la brten nas /
translated: And whoever arouses the Awakening Mind in the bodhisattva, on that basis

original: de ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyis 'dod pa'i longs spyod la gnas par brjod par mi bya /
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyis 'dod pa'i longs spyod la gnas par brjod par mi bya /
translated: one should not say that person abides in the enjoyment of the afflictions.

original: de ni nam du yang tshangs par spyod pa la gnas par brjod par mi bya /
analyzed: de ni nam du yang tshangs par spyod pa la gnas par brjod par mi bya /
translated: It should not be said that he ever abides in pure conduct.

original: de ni gzugs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs kyang gzugs med par nye bar 'gro bar brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ni gzugs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs kyang gzugs med par nye bar 'gro bar brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: Even though he enters the formless concentrations, it should not be said that he goes to the formless realm.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ni nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis mi skye ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ni nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis mi skye ste /
translated: Because that bodhisattva is not born by the power of the afflictions.

original: @23b byang chub sems dpa' ni smon lam gyi dbang gis skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @23b byang chub sems dpa' ni smon lam gyi dbang gis skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The bodhisattva is born by the power of his vow.

original: de ni byis pa'i spyod pa thams cad las grol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni byis pa'i spyod pa thams cad las grol ba'i phyir /
translated: He is free from all the conduct of the childish.

original: gang byang chub sems dpa'i nyon mongs pa rnams ston par 'dod pa des ni /
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa'i nyon mongs pa rnams ston par 'dod pa des ni /
translated: Therefore, anyone who wishes to point out the afflictions of the bodhisattva

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi gzugs bstan par 'dod du zad do //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi gzugs bstan par 'dod du zad do //
translated: would be like someone who wishes to point out the form of the element of space.

original: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste /
translated: Noble sir, it is like this:

original: dper na klu thams cad klu nyid du spyir song ba yin pas klu'i rgyal po ma dros pa ni klu'i bgrang bar yang 'grol /
analyzed: dper na klu thams cad klu nyid du spyir song ba yin pas klu'i rgyal po ma dros pa ni klu'i bgrang bar yang 'grol /
translated: For example, since all nāgas are generally nāgas, the king of nāgas, Anavatapta, is counted as a nāga,🔽but he is not affected by the sufferings of the nāgas.

original: klu'i nyes pa gsum gyis kyang gos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: klu'i nyes pa gsum gyis kyang gos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He will not be tainted by the three faults of the nāgas.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: mgo la bye tshan mi 'bab pa dang / skye ba po'i lus dang lhan cig tu kun tu mi gnas pa dang / de la nam mkha' lding gi 'jigs pa mi 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: mgo la bye tshan mi 'bab pa dang / skye ba po'i lus dang lhan cig tu kun tu mi gnas pa dang / de la nam mkha' lding gi 'jigs pa mi 'byung ba ste /
translated: Sand will not fall on his head, he will not live together with the bodies of the nāgas, and he will not be afraid of the garuḍas.

original: rigs kyi bu klu'i skyon gsum po 'di dag gis gos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu klu'i skyon gsum po 'di dag gis gos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Son of noble family, he will not be tainted by these three faults of the nāgas.

original: rigs kyi bu de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtsed mo dang / dga' ba thams cad nyams su myong bar byed kyang srid pa gsum du 'dod pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal rnams kyis zil gyis mi non par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtsed mo dang / dga' ba thams cad nyams su myong bar byed kyang srid pa gsum du 'dod pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal rnams kyis zil gyis mi non par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Son of noble family, in the same way, you should understand that the bodhisattva mahāsattvas experience all the pleasures and enjoyments, yet they are not overwhelmed by the desires, afflictions, and sufferings of the three existences.

original: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Son of noble family, it is like this:

original: sems can gyi rigs nya zhes bya ba yod de /
analyzed: sems can gyi rigs nya zhes bya ba yod de /
translated: there is a class of beings called fish.

original: de ni chu la spyod chu la lta yang /
analyzed: de ni chu la spyod chu la lta yang /
translated: They live in the water and look at the water,

original: der 'chi ba'i dus byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der 'chi ba'i dus byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: but they do not die there.

original: rigs kyi bu de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'khor ba na spyod kyang /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'khor ba na spyod kyang /
translated: Son of noble family, in the same way, a bodhisattva-mahāsattva, though active in saṃsāra,

original: de nyid du byis pa'i spyod pa la gnas kyang /
analyzed: de nyid du byis pa'i spyod pa la gnas kyang /
translated: though abiding in the conduct of a child,

original: ye shes kyi spyod pa 'tshol lo //
analyzed: ye shes kyi spyod pa 'tshol lo //
translated: seeks the conduct of wisdom.

original: chos yang dag par blangs pas kyang rmongs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos yang dag par blangs pas kyang rmongs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And through taking up the Dharma, he does not become confused.

original: byis pa dang lhan cig tu gnas pas /
analyzed: byis pa dang lhan cig tu gnas pas /
translated: Because of dwelling together with the childish,

original: srid pa gsum gyi sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: srid pa gsum gyi sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: he does not experience the suffering of the three existences.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdag bsrung bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdag bsrung bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva should protect himself.”

original: rnam par 'thag pa thams cad bsdus pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: rnam par 'thag pa thams cad bsdus pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: And in the Sūtra Gathering All the Threads:

original: mi pham pa sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus bskal pa grangs med pa'i yang ches grangs med pa de'i tshe de'i dus na /
analyzed: mi pham pa sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus bskal pa grangs med pa'i yang ches grangs med pa de'i tshe de'i dus na /
translated: Ajita, in the past, countless, truly countless eons ago,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dri ma med pa'i 'od 'phro las byung ba'i grags pa zhes bya ba 'jig rten du byung ste /🔽des lo khrag khrig brgyad @24a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dri ma med pa'i 'od 'phro las byung ba'i grags pa zhes bya ba 'jig rten du byung ste / des lo khrag khrig brgyad @24a * //
translated: The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, Vimalaprabhāsaśrīsaṃbhava appeared in the world.

original: cur sems can rnams la chas bstan to //
analyzed: cur sems can rnams la chas bstan to //
translated: He taught the Dharma to sentient beings for eighty-four thousand years.

original: de'i gsung rab la dge slong 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba chos smra ba /
analyzed: de'i gsung rab la dge slong 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba chos smra ba /
translated: In his doctrine there was a monk named Pariśuddha-ājīva, a Dharma teacher,

original: gtam sna tshogs smra ba /
analyzed: gtam sna tshogs smra ba /
translated: a speaker of various stories,

original: skye bo mang po la yang dag par bstan pa /🔽skye bo mang po la yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa /🔽skye bo mang po la yang dag par gzengs bstod pa /
analyzed: skye bo mang po la yang dag par bstan pa / skye bo mang po la yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa / skye bo mang po la yang dag par gzengs bstod pa /
translated: one who truly taught to many people,🔽one who truly caused many people to uphold [the Dharma],🔽one who truly inspired many people,

original: skye bo mang po la yang dag par dga' bar byed pa byung nas /
analyzed: skye bo mang po la yang dag par dga' bar byed pa byung nas /
translated: and one who truly delighted many people.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa dri ma med pa'i 'od 'phro las byung ba'i grags pa des /🔽phyi ma'i tshe phyi ma'i dus na /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa dri ma med pa'i 'od 'phro las byung ba'i grags pa des / phyi ma'i tshe phyi ma'i dus na /
translated: That Tathāgata Vimalaprabhāsaśrīsaṃbhava

original: dam pa'i chos bsdu bar bcol te /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos bsdu bar bcol te /
translated: entrusted the compilation of the true Dharma🔽to him for the future and later times.

original: des de bzhin gshegs pa de yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu lo bye bar dam bcas pa'i chos kyi tshul bzung ste /
analyzed: des de bzhin gshegs pa de yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu lo bye bar dam bcas pa'i chos kyi tshul bzung ste /
translated: After the parinirvāṇa of that Tathāgata, for ten million years he upheld the way of the Dharma that had been taught.

original: de rnam par 'thag pa thams cad bsdus pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di la zhugs nas chos ston te /
analyzed: de rnam par 'thag pa thams cad bsdus pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di la zhugs nas chos ston te /
translated: He entered this Dharma discourse that collects all the sūtras and taught the Dharma.

original: mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can rnams la chos ston to //🔽des grong khyer stong phrag brgyad cur smon lam ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can rnams la chos ston to // des grong khyer stong phrag brgyad cur smon lam ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: He taught the Dharma to beings in accordance with their aspirations.

original: sems can rnams rab tu dga' bar byas nas /
analyzed: sems can rnams rab tu dga' bar byas nas /
translated: In eighty thousand cities, he delighted beings in accordance with their aspirations.

original: de grong khyer chen po bzang po zhes bya bar song ste /
analyzed: de grong khyer chen po bzang po zhes bya bar song ste /
translated: Then he went to the great city called Bhadra.

original: khyim pa bye ba phrag brgyad cu la mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos bstan nas /
analyzed: khyim pa bye ba phrag brgyad cu la mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos bstan nas /
translated: He taught the Dharma to eighty million householders in accordance with their aspirations.

original: grong khyer de nas srog chags bye ba phrag brgyad cu rab tu dad par byas so //
analyzed: grong khyer de nas srog chags bye ba phrag brgyad cu rab tu dad par byas so //
translated: He delighted eighty million beings in that city.

original: de'i nang nas bye ba phrag gcig ni byang chub la rab tu bkod do //
analyzed: de'i nang nas bye ba phrag gcig ni byang chub la rab tu bkod do //
translated: Among them, he established one million in awakening.

original: sems can bye ba phrag bdun cu rtsa dgu ni nyan thos kyi theg pa la rab tu bkod de btul lo //
analyzed: sems can bye ba phrag bdun cu rtsa dgu ni nyan thos kyi theg pa la rab tu bkod de btul lo //
translated: He established 7,900,000,000 sentient beings in the vehicle of the hearers and tamed them.

original: de nas dge slong 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa de dge slong khri dang lhan cig tu byang chub kyi snying po ga la ba der yul rgyu zhing song ngo //🔽mi pham pa dge slong 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa song nas ring po ma lon par grong khyer chen po bzang po der /
analyzed: de nas dge slong 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa de dge slong khri dang lhan cig tu byang chub kyi snying po ga la ba der yul rgyu zhing song ngo // mi pham pa dge slong 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa song nas ring po ma lon par grong khyer chen po bzang po der /
translated: “Then, the bhikṣu Pure Life, together with ten thousand bhikṣus, traveled to the place where the Bodhimaṇḍa was.

original: dge slong chos zhes bya ba phyin te /
analyzed: dge slong chos zhes bya ba phyin te /
translated: Ajita, not long after the bhikṣu Pure Life had left, a bhikṣu called Dharma arrived in that great city of Bhadraṃkara.

original: des rnam par 'thag pa'i mdo stong bzung ngo //
analyzed: des rnam par 'thag pa'i mdo stong bzung ngo //
translated: He had memorized one thousand sūtras from the Saṃgīti class.

original: bsam gtan bzhi yang thob par gyur to //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi yang thob par gyur to //
translated: He had also attained the four dhyānas.

original: dge slong 'tsho ba yongs su dag pas ni mdo sde bye ba phrag bcu dang / rnam par 'thag pa'i mdo drug khri bzung bar gyur to //
analyzed: dge slong 'tsho ba yongs su dag pas ni mdo sde bye ba phrag bcu dang / rnam par 'thag pa'i mdo drug khri bzung bar gyur to //
