analyzed: bdag nyid kyis gang tshigs su bcad pa nyos pa ni rang gi lus yongs su btang ba dang / chung ma yongs su btang ba dang / bu dang bu mo yongs su btang ba dang / rgyal srid yongs su btang bas nyos shing /
translated: I bought the verses I knew with my own body, with the gift of my wife, with the gift of my sons and daughters, and with the gift of my kingdom.

original: byams pa legs par bshad pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gi phyir 'dzam bu'i gling byin te /
analyzed: byams pa legs par bshad pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gi phyir 'dzam bu'i gling byin te /
translated: Maitreya, I remember giving the entire world, the entire earth, for the sake of a single verse of good advice.

original: nyos par ngas mngon par dran na /
analyzed: nyos par ngas mngon par dran na /
translated: I bought it.

original: de dag ni rnyed pa dang / bkur sti bsrung zhing sangs rgyas dang 'dra ba'i gnas su 'gro bar mi sems so //
analyzed: de dag ni rnyed pa dang / bkur sti bsrung zhing sangs rgyas dang 'dra ba'i gnas su 'gro bar mi sems so //
translated: They do not think of protecting their gain and honor, and they do not think of going to a place that is like the Buddha.

original: mi pham pa dam pa'i chos kyi tshul 'di bzung ba yang 'byor pa dang ldan pas nus kyi mi ldan pas ma yin no //
analyzed: mi pham pa dam pa'i chos kyi tshul 'di bzung ba yang 'byor pa dang ldan pas nus kyi mi ldan pas ma yin no //
translated: Ajita, those who uphold this Dharma method will be able to do so with wealth, not without wealth.”

original: mi pham pa ngas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: mi pham pa ngas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: Ajita, after I fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyis chos gang bstan pa de la de dag 'di skad du /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyis chos gang bstan pa de la de dag 'di skad du /
translated: I taught the Dharma with the wisdom of a buddha.

original: de ni lung ma nod par bya ba ma yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: de ni lung ma nod par bya ba ma yin no zhes zer te /
translated: They said, ‘That is not to be recited.’

original: sems can de dag 'byung ba ma yin te nyes pa chen po ji tsam dang ldan pa la ltos /
analyzed: sems can de dag 'byung ba ma yin te nyes pa chen po ji tsam dang ldan pa la ltos /
translated: Those beings did not appear, and see how much great negativity they had.

original: mi pham pa dge slong chos des rnam par 'thag pa'i mdo stong bstan te /
analyzed: mi pham pa dge slong chos des rnam par 'thag pa'i mdo stong bstan te /
translated: Ajita, the monk Dharmasvāmin taught the Sūtra of the Exposition in a thousand places.

original: bsam gtan bzhi bskyed kyang de lta bu'i gnas su gyur na /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi bskyed kyang de lta bu'i gnas su gyur na /
translated: He generated the four concentrations, but he became like that.

original: gang phyogs tsam mam cha tsam la reg pa rnam par 'thag pa 'dzin pa'i dge slong rnams la mngon par mi dga' zhing /
analyzed: gang phyogs tsam mam cha tsam la reg pa rnam par 'thag pa 'dzin pa'i dge slong rnams la mngon par mi dga' zhing /
translated: How much less would those monks who merely touched on a fraction or a part of the exposition be pleased,

original: rnam par 'thag pa la skyon 'dogs pa lta ci smos te /
analyzed: rnam par 'thag pa la skyon 'dogs pa lta ci smos te /
translated: let alone those who would find fault with the exposition?

original: de dag ni chos smra ba'i dge slong la skur pa 'debs pa yin /
analyzed: de dag ni chos smra ba'i dge slong la skur pa 'debs pa yin /
translated: They would be denigrating the monk who was teaching the Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos spong ba yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos spong ba yin /
translated: They would be rejecting the Dharma of the Buddha.

original: rlom sems chen pos skur pa 'debs pa yin te /
analyzed: rlom sems chen pos skur pa 'debs pa yin te /
translated: They would be denigrating with great conceit.

original: sems can dmyal bar skye ba de dag la ni legs par byas zhes nga mi smra'o /
analyzed: sems can dmyal bar skye ba de dag la ni legs par byas zhes nga mi smra'o /
translated: I do not say that those who are born in the hells have done what is good.

original: @26b de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: @26b de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang dag chos smra ba la rnam par smod pa de dag ni /
analyzed: gang dag chos smra ba la rnam par smod pa de dag ni /
translated: Those who disparage the Dharma teachers

original: sangs rgyas la rnam par smod pa yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la rnam par smod pa yin /
translated: disparage the Buddha.

original: chos la rnam par smod pa yin no //
analyzed: chos la rnam par smod pa yin no //
translated: They disparage the Dharma.

original: gang dag chos smra ba la rim gro med pa de dag ni sangs rgyas la rim gro med pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dag chos smra ba la rim gro med pa de dag ni sangs rgyas la rim gro med pa yin no //
translated: Those who do not respect the Dharma teachers do not respect the Buddha.

original: gang dag chos smra ba la mi snyan par brjod pa de dag ni /
analyzed: gang dag chos smra ba la mi snyan par brjod pa de dag ni /
translated: Those who speak unpleasantly to the Dharma teachers

original: sangs rgyas mthong bar mi 'dod pa yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas mthong bar mi 'dod pa yin /
translated: do not wish to see the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas la mi snyan par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la mi snyan par brjod pa yin no //
translated: They speak unpleasantly to the Buddha.

original: gang dag sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la khong khro ba'i sems bskyed pa de dag gis ni /
analyzed: gang dag sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la khong khro ba'i sems bskyed pa de dag gis ni /
translated: Those who arouse angry thoughts toward the bodhisattvas who have newly aroused the mind

original: sangs rgyas yongs su btang ba yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas yongs su btang ba yin te /
translated: have abandoned the Buddha.

original: ji snyed du khong khro ba'i sems skyed par byed pa de snyed kyi bskal par sems can dmyal bar gnas par go cha bgos so //
analyzed: ji snyed du khong khro ba'i sems skyed par byed pa de snyed kyi bskal par sems can dmyal bar gnas par go cha bgos so //
translated: I have taken up the armor for as many eons as there are moments of anger.

original: ji tsam du khong khro ba'i mig gis lta ba de srid du long ba'i skye mched thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji tsam du khong khro ba'i mig gis lta ba de srid du long ba'i skye mched thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: For as long as I have looked upon others with angry eyes, for that long I have been born blind.

original: ji tsam du mi snyan par brjod pa de srid du lce'i skye mched med pa thob par 'gyur ro //🔽mi pham pa ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gnod pa'i sems bskyed pas /
analyzed: ji tsam du mi snyan par brjod pa de srid du lce'i skye mched med pa thob par 'gyur ro // mi pham pa ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gnod pa'i sems bskyed pas /
translated: For as long as I have spoken unpleasantly, for that long I have been born without a tongue.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ngan song du log par lhung bar 'gyur ba'i chos de lta bu gzhan ni ngas ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ngan song du log par lhung bar 'gyur ba'i chos de lta bu gzhan ni ngas ma mthong ngo //
translated: Ajita, I do not see any other single factor that causes bodhisattvas to fall into the lower realms as much as the arising of an angry thought.

original: mi pham pa sems can gyi 'du shes dang / chos kyi 'du shes la gnas pa rnams la ni /
analyzed: mi pham pa sems can gyi 'du shes dang / chos kyi 'du shes la gnas pa rnams la ni /
translated: Ajita, those who abide in the perception of sentient beings and the perception of phenomena

original: las mngon par 'du byas pa yod de /
analyzed: las mngon par 'du byas pa yod de /
translated: will create karma.

original: mi dmigs pa la ni med do //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa la ni med do //
translated: But those who do not objectify anything will not.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag chos tha dad du 'byed cing ston pa de dag ni spros pa la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag chos tha dad du 'byed cing ston pa de dag ni spros pa la gnas pa yin no //
translated: Those bodhisattvas who teach by differentiating the Dharma are attached to mental elaboration.

original: mi pham pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa drug yang dag par grub pa ni /
analyzed: mi pham pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa drug yang dag par grub pa ni /
translated: Ajita, the six perfections of the bodhisattvas are fully accomplished

original: byang chub kyi phyir yin na /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyir yin na /
translated: for the sake of enlightenment.

original: de la yang mi blun po de dag 'di skad du /
analyzed: de la yang mi blun po de dag 'di skad du /
translated: But those fools say

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa kho na la byang chub sems dpas bslab par bya'o zhes zer zhing pha rol tu phyin pa lhag ma rnams sun 'byin to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa kho na la byang chub sems dpas bslab par bya'o zhes zer zhing pha rol tu phyin pa lhag ma rnams sun 'byin to //
translated: that bodhisattvas should train only in the perfection of wisdom, and they disparage the other perfections.

original: mi pham pa 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: mi pham pa 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: Ajita, what do you think?

original: ka shi ka'i rgyal po gang yin pas mgo byin par gyur pa de 'chal ba'i shes rab yin nam /
analyzed: ka shi ka'i rgyal po gang yin pas mgo byin par gyur pa de 'chal ba'i shes rab yin nam /
translated: Was the king of Kashi, who gave his head, of faulty wisdom?

original: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das de ni ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gsol pa bcom ldan 'das de ni ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: He replied, “Blessed One, he was not.”

original: chos thams cad 'byung ba med par bstan pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: chos thams cad 'byung ba med par bstan pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The Sutra Teaching the Non-Arising of All Things also says,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rgyal ba'i blo gros kyang 'chi ba'i dus bgyis nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rgyal ba'i blo gros kyang 'chi ba'i dus bgyis nas /
translated: The bodhisattva Jayamati died,

original: dog sa'i sgo phye ste /
analyzed: dog sa'i sgo phye ste /
translated: and the gates of hell opened up.

original: sems can dmyal ba chen por @27a * //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba chen por @27a * //
translated: He fell into the great hells

original: ltung ngo // de su ga las kyi sgrib pa des /
analyzed: ltung ngo // de su ga las kyi sgrib pa des /
translated: and, due to that karmic obscuration,

original: bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong du sems can dmyal ba chen po dag tu sdug bsngal tsha zhing rtsub la yid du mi 'ong ba'i tshor ba mi bzad pa myong bar gyur to //
analyzed: bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong du sems can dmyal ba chen po dag tu sdug bsngal tsha zhing rtsub la yid du mi 'ong ba'i tshor ba mi bzad pa myong bar gyur to //
translated: he experienced unbearable, intense, harsh, and unpleasant feelings in the great hells for a hundred thousand quintillion eons.

original: tshe rabs brgya stong phrag bdun cu rtsa bzhir mi snyan par brjod pa thob par gyur to //
analyzed: tshe rabs brgya stong phrag bdun cu rtsa bzhir mi snyan par brjod pa thob par gyur to //
translated: For seventy-four hundred thousand lifetimes he was reviled.

original: bskal pa brgya stong mang por de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan tsam yang ma thos par gyur to //
analyzed: bskal pa brgya stong mang por de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan tsam yang ma thos par gyur to //
translated: For many hundreds of thousands of eons he did not even hear the name of the Tathāgata.

original: de de nas slad kyi de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan dang gzhan dag mjal te /
analyzed: de de nas slad kyi de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan dang gzhan dag mjal te /
translated: Later, he met other tathāgatas,

original: de dag gi bstan pa la rab tu byung nas mngon par mos par ma gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gi bstan pa la rab tu byung nas mngon par mos par ma gyur te /
translated: and when he went forth in their teachings, he did not have faith in them.

original: tshe rabs stong phrag bdun cu rtsa drug tu rab tu byung ba las slar babs par gyur to //
analyzed: tshe rabs stong phrag bdun cu rtsa drug tu rab tu byung ba las slar babs par gyur to //
translated: For seventy-six thousand lifetimes, he was reborn as a renunciant, and then he fell back.

original: sug las kyi sgrib pa de nyid kyi lhag mas /
analyzed: sug las kyi sgrib pa de nyid kyi lhag mas /
translated: Due to the remainder of that karmic obscuration,

original: tshe rabs stong phrag mang por dbang po rtul bar gyur to //
analyzed: tshe rabs stong phrag mang por dbang po rtul bar gyur to //
translated: for many thousands of lifetimes, he had dull faculties.

original: bcom ldan 'das de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' dge slong chos smra ba rab tu dga' ba'i dbang po zhes bgyi ba byung bas ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' dge slong chos smra ba rab tu dga' ba'i dbang po zhes bgyi ba byung bas ni /
translated: Bhagavān, at that time, there was a bodhisattva bhikṣu dharmabhāṇaka named Nandīprabhāsa.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: He attained the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood.

original: da ltar bzhugs shing 'tsho gzhes chos kyang ston to //
analyzed: da ltar bzhugs shing 'tsho gzhes chos kyang ston to //
translated: He is alive at present, lives, and remains. He is teaching the Dharma.

original: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba brgya stong 'das pa na /
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba brgya stong 'das pa na /
translated: “Bhagavān, in the east, past one billion world realms,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing rin po che sna tshogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing rin po che sna tshogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na /
translated: in the world realm called Ratnasaṃbhava,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gzi brjid sdug cing dri ma med la nyi zla zil gyis gnon pa bzhugs shing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gzi brjid sdug cing dri ma med la nyi zla zil gyis gnon pa bzhugs shing /
translated: The thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha Splendid and Stainless, Who Outshines the Sun and Moon,

original: 'tsho gzhes chos kyang ston te /
analyzed: 'tsho gzhes chos kyang ston te /
translated: is alive and well and still teaching the Dharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das dge slong rgyal ba'i blo gros zhes bgyi bar gang gyur pa de ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dge slong rgyal ba'i blo gros zhes bgyi bar gang gyur pa de ni /
translated: Blessed One, the one who was the monk Jayamati🔽was me.

original: bdag nyid de'i tshe de'i dus na /
analyzed: bdag nyid de'i tshe de'i dus na /
translated: At that time, at that point in time,

original: dge slong rgyal ba'i blo gros zhes bgyi bar gyur te /
analyzed: dge slong rgyal ba'i blo gros zhes bgyi bar gyur te /
translated: I was the monk Jayamati.

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis de lta bu'i tshul 'di ma 'tshal bas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis de lta bu'i tshul 'di ma 'tshal bas /
translated: Blessed One, because I did not understand this way of being,

original: de lta bu'i sdug bsngal myong bar gyur to //
analyzed: de lta bu'i sdug bsngal myong bar gyur to //
translated: I experienced such suffering.

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag ni de 'dra ba'i gnas su gyur te /🔽de lta bu'i sdug bsngal ma mchis ba'i sdug bsngal /🔽yongs su brtags pa'i sdug bsngal /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag ni de 'dra ba'i gnas su gyur te / de lta bu'i sdug bsngal ma mchis ba'i sdug bsngal / yongs su brtags pa'i sdug bsngal /
translated: Blessed One, I was in such a situation,🔽and I experienced such suffering, which is not suffering,🔽but rather a suffering of imputation,

original: phyin ci log gi sdug bsngal rnam pa de lta bu myong bar gyur to //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi sdug bsngal rnam pa de lta bu myong bar gyur to //
translated: a suffering of error.

original: bcom ldan 'das de lta lags pas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de lta lags pas /
translated: Blessed One, that being so,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la zhugs pa 'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la zhugs pa 'am /
translated: or who have entered the vehicle of the bodhisattvas,

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa la zhugs pa gang yang rung ste /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa la zhugs pa gang yang rung ste /
translated: Whether one is a bodhisattva or a śrāvaka,

original: de lta bu'i sug @27b las kyi sgrib pa mi 'tshal zhing /
analyzed: de lta bu'i sug @27b las kyi sgrib pa mi 'tshal zhing /
translated: if one does not want such karmic obscurations

original: de lta bu'i sdug bsngal mi 'tshal na /🔽des dam pa'i chos spang bar mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i sdug bsngal mi 'tshal na / des dam pa'i chos spang bar mi bgyi'o //
translated: and does not want such suffering,🔽one should not abandon the true Dharma.

original: dam pa'i chos la dbye bar mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos la dbye bar mi bgyi'o //
translated: One should not divide the true Dharma.

original: chos gang la yang khong khro bar mi bgyi'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: chos gang la yang khong khro bar mi bgyi'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: One should not be hostile to any Dharma.

original: chos spong ba la dgongs pa bstan pa snying rje chen po la 'jug pa'i mdo las kyang /🔽'jig rten 'bras bu'i 'du shes can //
analyzed: chos spong ba la dgongs pa bstan pa snying rje chen po la 'jug pa'i mdo las kyang / 'jig rten 'bras bu'i 'du shes can //
translated: The Sūtra on Entering Great Compassion, which explains the intention behind abandoning the Dharma, says:🔽In the future, there will be those

original: phyi ma'i dus na 'byung 'gyur te //
analyzed: phyi ma'i dus na 'byung 'gyur te //
translated: who have the idea that the world is the result

original: de dag dgra bcom pa yi zas //
analyzed: de dag dgra bcom pa yi zas //
translated: of the food of arhats,

original: zos nas sangs rgyas spong bar byed //🔽gang gis 'dzam bu'i gling 'dir ni //
analyzed: zos nas sangs rgyas spong bar byed // gang gis 'dzam bu'i gling 'dir ni //
translated: and who abandon the Buddha.🔽Those who destroy all the stūpas

original: mchod rten thams cad bshig byed pas //🔽gang zhig mdo sde spong byed pa'i //
analyzed: mchod rten thams cad bshig byed pas // gang zhig mdo sde spong byed pa'i //
translated: in this Rose Apple Continent🔽have a sin that is far outshined

original: sdig pa 'di ni ches khyad 'phags //
analyzed: sdig pa 'di ni ches khyad 'phags //
translated: by that of those who abandon the sūtras.

original: gang gis gang g'a'i bye snyed kyi //🔽dgra bcom bsad par gyur pa bas //
analyzed: gang gis gang g'a'i bye snyed kyi // dgra bcom bsad par gyur pa bas //
translated: Whoever kills as many🔽Arhats as there are grains of sand in the Ganges

original: gang zhig mdo sde spong byed pa'i //
analyzed: gang zhig mdo sde spong byed pa'i //
translated: Is outdone by the evil of those who reject the sutras.

original: sdig pa 'di ni ches khyad 'phags //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sdig pa 'di ni ches khyad 'phags // zhes gsungs so //
translated: This evil is far greater.

original: rnam par 'thag pa thams cad bsdus pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: rnam par 'thag pa thams cad bsdus pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The Sutra Gathering All the Threads also says:

original: 'jam dpal dam pa'i chos spong ba'i las kyi sgrib pa ni phra'o //🔽'jam dpal gang de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i bka' la la ni bzang bar 'du shes la /
analyzed: 'jam dpal dam pa'i chos spong ba'i las kyi sgrib pa ni phra'o // 'jam dpal gang de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i bka' la la ni bzang bar 'du shes la /
translated: Manjushri, the karmic obstruction of rejecting the true Dharma is subtle.

original: la la ni ngan par 'du shes pa de ni chos spong ba'o //
analyzed: la la ni ngan par 'du shes pa de ni chos spong ba'o //
translated: Manjushri, those who think that some of the Tathagata’s words are good and some are not are rejecting the Dharma.

original: gang chos spong ba des chos spangs pas /
analyzed: gang chos spong ba des chos spangs pas /
translated: Those who reject the Dharma reject the Dharma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la skur pa 'debs pa yin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la skur pa 'debs pa yin /
translated: By rejecting the Dharma, they slander the Tathagata.

original: dge 'dun la ngan du brjod pa yin no //🔽'di ni rigs pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun la ngan du brjod pa yin no // 'di ni rigs pa'o //
translated: They speak ill of the Sangha.🔽They say, “This is reasonable.”

original: 'di ni mi rigs pa'o zhes zer na chos spong ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni mi rigs pa'o zhes zer na chos spong ba yin no //
translated: They say, “This is unreasonable.”

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ched du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ched du gsungs pa'o //
translated: They say, “This was taught for bodhisattvas.”

original: 'di ni nyan thos rnams kyi ched du gsungs pa'o zhes zer na chos spong ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni nyan thos rnams kyi ched du gsungs pa'o zhes zer na chos spong ba yin no //
translated: If you say, ‘This was taught for the sake of the hearers,’ you are abandoning the Dharma.

original: 'di ni rang sangs rgyas kyi ched du gsungs pa'o zhes zer na chos spong ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rang sangs rgyas kyi ched du gsungs pa'o zhes zer na chos spong ba yin no //
translated: If you say, ‘This was taught for the sake of the solitary buddhas,’ you are abandoning the Dharma.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'o //
translated: If you say, ‘This is the training of the bodhisattvas,’

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa ma yin no zhes zer na dam pa'i chos spong ba yin no //🔽chos smra ba spobs pa yod do zhe 'am /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa ma yin no zhes zer na dam pa'i chos spong ba yin no // chos smra ba spobs pa yod do zhe 'am /
translated: and ‘This is not the training of the bodhisattvas,’ you are abandoning the sacred Dharma.

original: spobs pa med do zhes zer na chos spong ba yin no //

original: lag pa med par 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: lag pa med par 'gyur ba yin /

original: rkang pa med par 'gyur ba yin /🔽mdze can du 'gyur ba yin /🔽sha bkra can du 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: rkang pa med par 'gyur ba yin / mdze can du 'gyur ba yin / sha bkra can du 'gyur ba yin /

original: sgur por 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: sgur por 'gyur ba yin /
translated: with tuberculosis,🔽and with a hunch.

original: gang na sangs rgyas kyi sgra med pa dang / chos kyi sgra med pa dang / dge 'dun gyi sgra med pa de dag tu skye bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gang na sangs rgyas kyi sgra med pa dang / chos kyi sgra med pa dang / dge 'dun gyi sgra med pa de dag tu skye bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba nas /

original: rab 'byor skyes bu glen pa de dag rnam pa bzhis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa phyir spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor skyes bu glen pa de dag rnam pa bzhis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa phyir spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Subhūti, those foolish people will reject the perfection of wisdom in four ways.

original: gsol ba / bzhi gang dang gang zhig lags /
analyzed: gsol ba / bzhi gang dang gang zhig lags /
translated: ” Subhūti asked, “What are the four?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ;
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: skyes bu glen pa gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di spong ba de dag ni bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu glen pa gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di spong ba de dag ni bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa yin te /
translated: “Those foolish people who reject this profound perfection of wisdom are blessed by Māra.

original: rab 'byor rgyu dang po des na /
analyzed: rab 'byor rgyu dang po des na /
translated: Subhūti, because of that first cause,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la phyir spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la phyir spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: they will reject this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: chos zab mo rnams la yid ches pa dang dad cing mos pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: chos zab mo rnams la yid ches pa dang dad cing mos pa med pa yin te /
translated: They do not have confidence, faith, and interest in the profound teachings.

original: rgyu gnyis pa des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la phyir spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu gnyis pa des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la phyir spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For this second reason, they will reject this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor skyes bu glen pa de dag ni brtson 'grus med cing /
analyzed: rab 'byor skyes bu glen pa de dag ni brtson 'grus med cing /
translated: “Su­bhūti, those foolish persons are devoid of diligence,

original: phung po lnga la mngon par zhen pas /
analyzed: phung po lnga la mngon par zhen pas /
translated: and they are fixated on the five psycho-physical aggregates.

original: rgyu gsum pa des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la phyir spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu gsum pa des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la phyir spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For this third reason, they will reject this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor skyes bu glen pa de dag ni sdig pa'i grogs po'i lag tu song bas zhe sdang gi spyod pa can yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor skyes bu glen pa de dag ni sdig pa'i grogs po'i lag tu song bas zhe sdang gi spyod pa can yin te /
translated: “Su­bhūti, those foolish persons are in the hands of evil associates, and they are given to conduct that is full of hatred.

original: de dag bdag la bstod cing gzhan smod par gyur pas /
analyzed: de dag bdag la bstod cing gzhan smod par gyur pas /
translated: They praise themselves and disparage others.

original: rgyu bzhi pa des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di phyir spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu bzhi pa des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di phyir spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: For this fourth reason, they will reject this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor rnam pa bzhi po de dag gis skyes bu glen pa de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la phyir spong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam pa bzhi po de dag gis skyes bu glen pa de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la phyir spong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so //
translated: Subhūti, by these four aspects, those foolish people will reject this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: rgya cher rol pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: rgya cher rol pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: And in the Extensive Sport Sutra:

original: kun dga' bo da ltar skyes bu glen pa rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i zil gyis non pa /
analyzed: kun dga' bo da ltar skyes bu glen pa rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i zil gyis non pa /
translated: Ānanda, look at how many unwholesome actions those foolish people who are overcome by gain, honor, and fame,

original: mi gtsang par bying pa /🔽rim gro'i @32a * //
analyzed: mi gtsang par bying pa / rim gro'i @32a * //
translated: who are mired in impurity,

original: zil gyis non pa /
analyzed: zil gyis non pa /
translated: who are overcome by service,

original: ma rabs kyi ngang tshul can dag sangs rgyas kyi tshul spong zhing bsod nams ma yin pa mngon par 'du bya ba mang po ji snyed cig mngon par 'du byed pa la ltos /
analyzed: ma rabs kyi ngang tshul can dag sangs rgyas kyi tshul spong zhing bsod nams ma yin pa mngon par 'du bya ba mang po ji snyed cig mngon par 'du byed pa la ltos /
translated: who have a vulgar nature, are rejecting the way of the Buddha and are creating much demerit.

original: kun dga' bos gsol pa /
analyzed: kun dga' bos gsol pa /
translated: Ānanda said:

original: bcom ldan 'das ma byung ba'i dus na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma byung ba'i dus na /
translated: Blessed One, in the future

original: de lta bu'i mdo sde bzang po la yang spong zhing mi snyan par brjod pa de lta bu'i dge slong dag 'byung lags pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i mdo sde bzang po la yang spong zhing mi snyan par brjod pa de lta bu'i dge slong dag 'byung lags pa ste /
translated: there will be monks who will reject such excellent sutras and speak unpleasantly about them.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: kun dga' bo de dag ni mdo sde 'di lta bu spong zhing mi snyan par brjod par ma zad de /
analyzed: kun dga' bo de dag ni mdo sde 'di lta bu spong zhing mi snyan par brjod par ma zad de /
translated: “Ānanda, not only do they reject such sūtras and speak ill of them,

original: sdig pa rnam pa du ma mngon par 'du bya ba mngon par 'du byed cing /
analyzed: sdig pa rnam pa du ma mngon par 'du bya ba mngon par 'du byed cing /
translated: they also create and accumulate much evil.

original: dge sbyong gi dngos po don du mi gnyer ba dag kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi dngos po don du mi gnyer ba dag kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They do not strive for the state of a śramaṇa.🔽”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das 'o na skyes bu dam pa ma lags pa de 'dra ba de dag gi 'gro ba ni ci 'dra ba zhig tu 'gyur /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das 'o na skyes bu dam pa ma lags pa de 'dra ba de dag gi 'gro ba ni ci 'dra ba zhig tu 'gyur /
translated: Ānanda asked, “Blessed One, what will be the destiny of those who are not holy men but are like them?

original: tshe rabs 'phos nas ji lta bu zhig tu mchi /
analyzed: tshe rabs 'phos nas ji lta bu zhig tu mchi /
translated: What will happen to them when they die?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi byang chub med par byas te /
analyzed: de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi byang chub med par byas te /
translated: “They will destroy the enlightenment of the Buddha.

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la mi snyan pas skur ba btab pa'i 'gro ba gang yin pa'i 'gro ba der 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la mi snyan pas skur ba btab pa'i 'gro ba gang yin pa'i 'gro ba der 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will go to the destiny of those who have spoken ill of and disparaged the blessed buddhas of the past, present, and future.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo sgu g-yos nas sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo zhes brjod de bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo sgu g-yos nas sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo zhes brjod de bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda, having recovered, said to the Buddha, “I pay homage to the Buddha!”

original: bcom ldan 'das skyes bu dam pa ma lags pa de dag gi spyod pa 'di thos nas bdag ni brgyal ba dang 'dra bar gyur to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das skyes bu dam pa ma lags pa de dag gi spyod pa 'di thos nas bdag ni brgyal ba dang 'dra bar gyur to //
translated: And he said to the Blessed One, “Blessed One, having heard the conduct of those wicked people, I felt as if I were fainting.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: kun dga' bo de dag gi spyod pa ni mnyam par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: kun dga' bo de dag gi spyod pa ni mnyam par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: “Ānanda, their conduct will not be equal,

original: sems can de dag ni mi mnyam pa'i spyod pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can de dag ni mi mnyam pa'i spyod pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: and those beings will have unequal conduct.

original: kun dga' bo de dag ni tshul dang mi 'dra ba'i spyod pa des /
analyzed: kun dga' bo de dag ni tshul dang mi 'dra ba'i spyod pa des /
translated: Ānanda, by that conduct that is not in accordance with the rules,

original: mnar med pa'i sems can dmyal ba chen por ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mnar med pa'i sems can dmyal ba chen por ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: they will fall into the great Avīci hell.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽kun dga' bo dge slong ngam /🔽dge slong ma'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / kun dga' bo dge slong ngam / dge slong ma'am /
translated: Why is that?🔽Ānanda, whether a monk,🔽or a nun,

original: dge bsnyen nam /
analyzed: dge bsnyen nam /
translated: or a layman,

original: dge bsnyen ma gang la la zhig mdo sde 'di lta bu 'di dag thos nas ma mos shing yid mi ches pa dang / spong ba de dag ni shi 'phos ma thag tu mnar med pa'i sems can dmyal ba chen por ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge bsnyen ma gang la la zhig mdo sde 'di lta bu 'di dag thos nas ma mos shing yid mi ches pa dang / spong ba de dag ni shi 'phos ma thag tu mnar med pa'i sems can dmyal ba chen por ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Any lay person who, having heard such sūtras as this, does not believe in them, does not have confidence in them, and rejects them, will, immediately after death, fall into the great Avīci hell.

original: kun dga' bo de bzhin gshegs pa la @32b ni tshad du ma byed cig ces gsungs so //
analyzed: kun dga' bo de bzhin gshegs pa la @32b ni tshad du ma byed cig ces gsungs so //
translated: Ānanda, do not measure the Tathāgata.”

original: sangs rgyas kyi sde snod kyi mdo las kyang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sde snod kyi mdo las kyang /
translated: The Sūtra of the Buddha’s Discourses says,

analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu dge slong ji snyed pa sangs rgyas kyi byang chub /
translated: “Śāriputra, there are monks who have not understood the Buddha’s enlightenment,

original: don zab mo /
analyzed: don zab mo /
translated: the profound meaning,

original: dmigs pa med pa /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa /
translated: the objectless,

original: don dam pa /
analyzed: don dam pa /
translated: the ultimate,

original: stong pa nyid khong du ma chud par /
analyzed: stong pa nyid khong du ma chud par /
translated: emptiness.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i mdo sde de lta bu'i ngo bo 'di thos nas //
translated: Having heard such sūtras as this, which were spoken by the Tathāgata,

analyzed: de dag ni sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa ma yin no zhes spong zhing /
translated: they reject them, saying, ‘These were not spoken by the Buddha.’

original: skye bo rnams de ltar shes par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye bo rnams de ltar shes par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: They cause others to understand them in that way.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu gang chos spangs nas /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu gang chos spangs nas /
translated: Śāradvatīputra, those who reject the Dharma

original: dge sbyong du mi 'gyur /
analyzed: dge sbyong du mi 'gyur /

original: sh'akya'i sras por mi 'gyur pa 'di ni /
analyzed: sh'akya'i sras por mi 'gyur pa 'di ni /
translated: they are not sons of the Śākya.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas chos spong bar gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos spong bar gsungs so //
translated: The Tathāgata has said that they have abandoned the Dharma.

original: skyes bu blun po de ni srid pa na bye ba phrag brgya stong rnams la brlag par 'os pa'i rma chen po 'byin par byed do //
analyzed: skyes bu blun po de ni srid pa na bye ba phrag brgya stong rnams la brlag par 'os pa'i rma chen po 'byin par byed do //
translated: Those foolish people are the ones who, in existence, create a great wound that deserves to be punished a hundred thousand times.

original: don ma yin pa byed par 'gyur ro //🔽sha ra dva ti'i bu de lta bu'i rang bzhin can gyi dge slong rnams la /🔽gal te sangs rgyas stong phrag gam /
analyzed: don ma yin pa byed par 'gyur ro // sha ra dva ti'i bu de lta bu'i rang bzhin can gyi dge slong rnams la / gal te sangs rgyas stong phrag gam /
translated: They are the ones who do what is not beneficial.🔽“Śāradvatī­putra, if a thousand buddhas,

analyzed: sangs rgyas bye ba phrag brgya stong gis cho 'phrul gsum gyis chos ston par byed kyang /
translated: or a hundred thousand quintillion buddhas, were to teach the Dharma through the three kinds of miracles to such monks,

original: de dag gis chos ma shes shing /
analyzed: de dag gis chos ma shes shing /
translated: they would not understand the Dharma,

original: de dag gis 'bras bu thob par mi nus pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dag gis 'bras bu thob par mi nus pa nyid do //
translated: and they would be unable to attain the result.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa de dag ni lam 'gog pa ;
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa de dag ni lam 'gog pa ;
translated: Those who are not holy people block the path.

original: dad pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: dad pa dang bral ba /
translated: They are devoid of faith.

original: zas dang gos lhur len pa /
analyzed: zas dang gos lhur len pa /
translated: They are intent on food and clothing.

original: 'jig rten gyi zang zing la brkam pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi zang zing la brkam pa /

original: sems can dmyal ba chen por 'gro ba yin no zhes nga smra'o //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba chen por 'gro ba yin no zhes nga smra'o //

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu khyod mos par bya /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu khyod mos par bya /

original: khyod kyis khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: khyod kyis khong du chud par bya ste /

original: chos dkon mchog 'di spangs nas bde 'grol re bar 'gyur bar mi bya'i /
analyzed: chos dkon mchog 'di spangs nas bde 'grol re bar 'gyur bar mi bya'i /

original: 'on kyang ngan 'gro la re bar 'gyur bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang ngan 'gro la re bar 'gyur bar bya'o //
translated: Instead, you should hope for a bad rebirth.

original: dmus long du re bar 'gyur bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dmus long du re bar 'gyur bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: You should hope to be born blind.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod las kyang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod las kyang /
translated: The Bodhisattva Collection also says:

original: sh'a ti'i bu sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na /
analyzed: sh'a ti'i bu sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na /
translated: Śāriputra, in the past,

analyzed: bskal pa dgu bcu rtsa gcig tu gyur pa de'i tshe de'i dus na /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnam par gzigs zhes bya ba /
translated: there was a thus-gone one, a worthy one, a perfect buddha called Vipaśyin,

original: rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa /
analyzed: rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa /
translated: who was learned and virtuous,

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: a blissful one,

original: 'jig rten mkhyen pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten mkhyen pa /
translated: a knower of the world,

original: skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba /
analyzed: skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba /
translated: a steersman who guides beings,

original: bla na med pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa /
translated: an unexcelled one,🔽and a teacher of gods and humans.

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa /
translated: He was the Teacher of gods and humans,

original: sangs rgyas bcom @33a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom @33a * //
translated: the Blessed Buddha.

original: ldan 'das 'jig rten du byung ba de'i gsung rab la sdig pa'i dge slong drug 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ldan 'das 'jig rten du byung ba de'i gsung rab la sdig pa'i dge slong drug 'di lta ste /
translated: In his teachings there were six sinful monks:

original: shin tu mthong ba zhes bya ba dang / rnyed sla dang / dga' byed dang / dge byed dang / grags pa dang / mes byin zhes bya ba rnams byung ste /
analyzed: shin tu mthong ba zhes bya ba dang / rnyed sla dang / dga' byed dang / dge byed dang / grags pa dang / mes byin zhes bya ba rnams byung ste /
translated: Supaśya, Sulabha, Nandaka, Kalyāṇa, Yaśas, and Agnidatta.

original: bdag tu smra ba /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba /
translated: They were proponents of the self,

original: gang zag tu smra ba /
analyzed: gang zag tu smra ba /
translated: proponents of the person,

original: chad par smra ba /
analyzed: chad par smra ba /
translated: proponents of annihilation,

original: rtag par smra ba rnams 'grogs ldang zhing phan tshun du yid rton cing gnas pa de dag gis /
analyzed: rtag par smra ba rnams 'grogs ldang zhing phan tshun du yid rton cing gnas pa de dag gis /
translated: and proponents of permanence. They associated with each other, and they lived in mutual trust.

original: khrims 'di lta bu zhig byas te /
analyzed: khrims 'di lta bu zhig byas te /
translated: They made this kind of rule:

original: bdag cag re res kyang khyim lnga brgya gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdag cag re res kyang khyim lnga brgya gzung bar bya'o //
translated: “Each of us will take charge of five hundred households.

original: khyim brgya yongs su rdzogs pa na der 'ongs te gcig la gcig bsnyad par bya'o //
analyzed: khyim brgya yongs su rdzogs pa na der 'ongs te gcig la gcig bsnyad par bya'o //
translated: When a hundred households have been completed, we will come there and inform each other.”

original: khyim nyi shu dang / sum cu dang / bzhi bcu dang / lnga bcu dang / brgyar ma grub pa la bsnyad par bya'o zhes de lta bu'i khrims byas nas /
analyzed: khyim nyi shu dang / sum cu dang / bzhi bcu dang / lnga bcu dang / brgyar ma grub pa la bsnyad par bya'o zhes de lta bu'i khrims byas nas /
translated: Twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, or even a hundred families may be slandered.

original: grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / ljongs dang / yul dang / pho brang 'khor du dod nas /
analyzed: grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / ljongs dang / yul dang / pho brang 'khor du dod nas /
translated: Having made such a rule, they went to the villages, towns, cities, countries, regions, and palaces.

original: de dag thams cad khyim gcig tu dong ngo //
analyzed: de dag thams cad khyim gcig tu dong ngo //
translated: They went to all of them and said, We are going to one house.

original: khyim du dong nas gcig la gcig thog ma nyid du sangs rgyas la mi snyan pa zer ro //
analyzed: khyim du dong nas gcig la gcig thog ma nyid du sangs rgyas la mi snyan pa zer ro //
translated: Having gone to the house, they first slandered the Buddha, saying, The Buddha is not good.

original: sangs rgyas la mi snyan pa ji skad ces zer zhe na /🔽khyim der phyin nas 'di skad ces smras te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la mi snyan pa ji skad ces zer zhe na / khyim der phyin nas 'di skad ces smras te /

original: bdag yod do //
analyzed: bdag yod do //
translated: Having gone to the house, they said, There is a self.

original: sems can yod do //
analyzed: sems can yod do //
translated: There are sentient beings.

original: srog yod do //
analyzed: srog yod do //
translated: There is life.

original: gang zag yod do //
analyzed: gang zag yod do //
translated: There is a person.

original: gal te bdag med du zin na 'ong ba su /

analyzed: brgyad dam / dbyig pas brdegs sam / mtshon gyis btab par gyur na /
translated: Maitreya, suppose that all the sentient beings included in the realm of sentient beings in a triple-thousand great one-thousand-fold world system were to beat, stab, and berate a bodhisattva.

original: byams pa 'di ji snyam du sems /🔽byang chub sems dpa' des sems can ji snyed cig la spyos pa 'am /
analyzed: byams pa 'di ji snyam du sems / byang chub sems dpa' des sems can ji snyed cig la spyos pa 'am /
translated: Maitreya, what do you think?

original: brgyad pa 'am /
analyzed: brgyad pa 'am /
translated: If a bodhisattva were to generate anger or hatred toward even one of those sentient beings,🔽how much more so toward many?

original: dbyig pas brdegs pa 'am /🔽mtshon gyis btab pa'i gzhi de las sdig pa 'am /
analyzed: dbyig pas brdegs pa 'am / mtshon gyis btab pa'i gzhi de las sdig pa 'am /
translated: or beaten with sticks,🔽or struck with weapons,🔽

original: smas pa dang nyams pa mang po bskyed par 'gyur snyam mam /🔽byams pas gsol pa /🔽bcom ldan 'das sems can gcig la gcig spyos sam /🔽brgyad dam / dbyig pas brdegs sam /
analyzed: smas pa dang nyams pa mang po bskyed par 'gyur snyam mam / byams pas gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das sems can gcig la gcig spyos sam / brgyad dam / dbyig pas brdegs sam /
translated: Or if they were to strike him with a stick or a weapon, would that cause him to generate much non-virtue, or to be injured or impaired?

original: mtshon gyis btab na yang bsod nams ma lags pa mang du bskyed lags na /
analyzed: mtshon gyis btab na yang bsod nams ma lags pa mang du bskyed lags na /
translated: Maitreya replied, Bhagavan, if sentient beings were to scold, beat, or strike with a weapon even a single sentient being, they would generate much non-virtue.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gang ji snyed pa thams cad lta smos kyang ci 'tshal /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gang ji snyed pa thams cad lta smos kyang ci 'tshal /
translated: If they were to do that to all the sentient beings in the three-billion-fold world-realms, what need is there to mention that?

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpas ni sems can 'ga' tsam la yang tha ba dang / zhe sdang dang / gnod sems bskyed par mi bgyi ba'i slad du'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpas ni sems can 'ga' tsam la yang tha ba dang / zhe sdang dang / gnod sems bskyed par mi bgyi ba'i slad du'o //
translated: Bhagavan, it is because bodhisattvas should not generate anger, hatred, or malice toward even a single sentient being.

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to the bodhisattva great being Maitreya:

original: byams pa byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams su gtogs pa'i sems can de dag thams cad spyos sam /🔽brgyad dam / dbyig pas brdegs sam /🔽mtshon gyis btab pa gang yin pa des ni /🔽byang chub sems dpa' gzhan zhig la /
analyzed: byams pa byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams su gtogs pa'i sems can de dag thams cad spyos sam / brgyad dam / dbyig pas brdegs sam / mtshon gyis btab pa gang yin pa des ni / byang chub sems dpa' gzhan zhig la /
translated: “Maitreya, suppose a bodhisattva were to scold, beat, or stab with a weapon all the sentient beings included in the three-billion-fold world-system.

original: tha na tha ba dang zhe sdang gi sems gcig tsam zhig bskyed par 'gyur ba de tsam du /
analyzed: tha na tha ba dang zhe sdang gi sems gcig tsam zhig bskyed par 'gyur ba de tsam du /
translated: But suppose another bodhisattva were to arouse just a single thought of anger or hostility toward another bodhisattva.🔽The first bodhisattva would generate far more negativity than the second.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de smras pa dang / nyams par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de smras pa dang / nyams par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The bodhisattva who arouses a thought of anger or hostility toward another bodhisattva will not be able to recover from that.

original: byams pa byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa' cig shos de la tha ba dang / zhe sdang gi sems skyed par byed na /
analyzed: byams pa byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa' cig shos de la tha ba dang / zhe sdang gi sems skyed par byed na /
translated: Maitreya, if a bodhisattva arouses a thought of anger or hostility toward another bodhisattva,

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub yongs su mi gtong ba zhig yin na /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub yongs su mi gtong ba zhig yin na /
translated: If a bodhisattva does not abandon Awakening,

original: sems ji snyed bskyed pa de snyed kho na'i bskal par byang chub kyi phyir yang go cha bgo bar bya dgos so //
analyzed: sems ji snyed bskyed pa de snyed kho na'i bskal par byang chub kyi phyir yang go cha bgo bar bya dgos so //
translated: he should don the armor for Awakening for as many eons as there are thoughts that he has generated.

original: byams pa 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: byams pa 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Maitreya, it is like this:

original: lcags ni lcags nyid kyis gcod par byed pa ma gtogs par /🔽bong @35b ba 'am /
analyzed: lcags ni lcags nyid kyis gcod par byed pa ma gtogs par / bong @35b ba 'am /
translated: iron is cut by iron,🔽not by wood,

original: shing ngam / rtsvas gcod par mi nus pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: shing ngam / rtsvas gcod par mi nus pa de bzhin du /
translated: not by a lump of earth.

original: byams pa byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yang /
analyzed: byams pa byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yang /
translated: In the same way, Maitreya, the wholesome actions of a bodhisattva

original: byang chub sems dpa' cig shos la tha ba dang / zhe sdang gi sems bskyed pas zad par byed pa ma gtogs par gzhan gyis zad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' cig shos la tha ba dang / zhe sdang gi sems bskyed pas zad par byed pa ma gtogs par gzhan gyis zad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: are exhausted by the generation of a hostile, angry thought toward another bodhisattva, but not by anything else.

original: byams pa de lta bas na /
analyzed: byams pa de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore, Maitreya,

original: khyed cag gis gcig la gcig zhes dang bcas pa dang / gcig la gcig gus pa dang bcas pas gnas par bya'o zhes de ltar bslab par bya zhing /
analyzed: khyed cag gis gcig la gcig zhes dang bcas pa dang / gcig la gcig gus pa dang bcas pas gnas par bya'o zhes de ltar bslab par bya zhing /
translated: you should train thinking, ‘I will live with respect and deference toward each other.’

original: sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la yang ston pa'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o zhes gsungs so /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la yang ston pa'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o zhes gsungs so /
translated: You should also generate the perception of a teacher toward a bodhisattva who has generated the first level of bodhichitta.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The perfection of wisdom sutras also say:

original: kun dga' bo gzhan yang gal te gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa pa dang / rtsod cing nga ni mchog tu gyur pa yin gyi khyed ni ma yin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: kun dga' bo gzhan yang gal te gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa pa dang / rtsod cing nga ni mchog tu gyur pa yin gyi khyed ni ma yin no zhes zer na /
translated: “Moreover, Ananda, if a person who is a bodhisattva and a person who is a shravaka argue, saying, ‘I am superior, you are not,’

original: de la bdud sdig to can 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de la bdud sdig to can 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Mara the Wrongdoer thinks, ‘
